1.content:
It was after school and you were walking home after returning from a field trip .

"Man that was one weird, field trip." you said to yourself

Upon returning home you were greeted by your who was working on her laptop.

"Hi, Jazz, how was your trip to the genetics center?" she asked looking up from her laptop.

"It was weird, mom, there trying to make a youth serum but it causes side effects on the animals they tested it on, and they also told us it doesn't work on humans, and I hope there right." you said

"Why?" your mom ask

"Because some of it accidentally spilled on me during the tour around the lab." you said

"Relax Jazz I'm sure they know what there doing." she told you but, you can tell she was worry.

"By the way where is everyone?" you asked noticing no one else was home.

"Your sisters went to the mall and your brother is over at a friend's home." your mom told you as she return to work on her laptop.

"Okay then.." you said "I'll be in my room if you need me."
1.title: Return to childhood

11.content:
You head upstairs to your room, eager to relax, but mom came up, clearly troubled. You wished you didn't tell her.

"Jazz, why would they be doing something like that?" mom asked. You grinned slightly.

"Medicinal perposes. The theory is to regress a damaged body part into complete health. Its incredible, but there are some issues. The scienists can't seem to get it to act directionally. Instead it affects the entire body, effectively making the entire body younger." You decided not to tell her about the other thing, that it seemed to also changed into females. The scientists told you and the rest of the class that all vertibrates, humans included at inheriantly female. Its only a hormone at the right moment that makes males, male. You shake your head, remembering the giggles of the girls.

"And how do you know it doesn't work on humans?" mom asked, her worry still present.

"Some guy in a lab coat told me that they had an accient last month. Spilt the same stuff onto him, And since he seems okay.... Dose must be too low." you said. You would had been much more concerned if you knew you recieved a much higher dose.
11.title: A mother's concern

111.content:
Soon after mom left, you started to feel weird.

"Must be more tired, than I thought." you said to yourself as you started to feel light headed. "Some sleep may help."

Due to the odd feeling throughout your body, you quickly fell asleep.

As you slept your body started to change; you shrunk a bit and your body became thinner and your hair grew out until it reached your shoulders.

While you were sleeping you let out a yawn, but instead of your usual low yawn, this one was higher and more feminine sounding.

By the time the changes were done your body was that of 5 year old girl.
111.title: you start to feel weird

choices: you've fainted and woke up again in a hospital
1111.content: A couple of hours later, you woke up, unaware of the changes to your life. You still felt woozy, so much you didn't that you was much smaller, or the fact you had shrunk out of your clothes. Stumbling out of bed, you half staggered to the bathroom. One aspect of the change that the genetic lab hadn't know about was the transformed animals all needed to pee after their re-plumbing, and much later, you speculated it must had to do with flushing out your system. You was too far out of it to realize the truth, and fortunately mom and the twins (who were back from the mall) were all downstairs, hence sparing them the sight of an unaware, naked little girl. You barged into the bathroom, and intinctively reached for your now vanished manhood, and released. the fact your hand only grabbed empty air, and a small trickle of urine flowed down your leg shocked you fully awake. Ignoring the embarassing fact you peed yourself, you took a look at your 5 year old body, and let out the most piercing shriek of your life.
1111.title: The bathroom scream scene

11111.content:
It's not long after your shriek that your mom rushed into the bathroom to see what was wrong.

"Who are you?" your mom asked as she was confused to see a little girl in her bathroom.

"Mom, it's me!" you said in high voice "It's Jazz!"

"Jazz!?" you mom asked clearly shocked "What happen to you!?"

"I don't know." you said tearing up a bit.

Mom trying to remain calm remember what you had said earlier "Jazz, I think that the dose of youth serum, you said spill on you was strong enough to work , but why are you a girl?"

You blushed a bit before answering " Its one of the the effects of the serum, I didn't tell you because I though nothing was going to happen." you blushed even more before speaking again " I also kind of had an accident."

Despite the situation your couldn't help but giggle at you.

Your mum picked you up helped you clean up and then took you into her room and sat you on her bed.

Mum I don't feel well and as soon as you said that your mum looked at you as your became younger and went from 5 year old girl not a....

choices: Your mom goes to get your sisters.
1111111.content:
"What's the matter baby?" your mom asks as you lay down. "Hold on, I'll be right back." Your mom says, rushing out of the room.

As she leaves, you have a strange feeling in your mouth, as if your teeth seem to be retracting into your gums. It doesn't hurt exactly, but it certainly doesn't feel normal.Then you notice your clothes growing.

What the heck's going on!? Why would the serum make my clothes larger? Why is everything getting larger? Why do I have a sudden urge to cry? You think to yourself as words seem to not be coming.

"MOOOOOM!!" is what you wanted to shout, but all that came out was an extremely high pitched scream while tears flood your vision. While you're crying, mom comes back in.

"Oh no what's- WHAT IN THE..." She stands there for a moment opening and closing her mouth, but no sound comes out. This is fine though, as you realize you're making more than enough noise to cover both your shocks. You are also keenly aware that even though you are now much younger, you still have full brain activity. As long as you don't go back any further, things should be fine. That'swhen you stop crying and realize something.

[i]Wait, this could be great. I could be lie, a baby genius or something. Let's see, 2+2=4. 5 squared is 25, Inertia is a property of matter. Yes![/i] You get a big grin on your face.

"Mom, I'm like a baby genius now! I still know how to do math and everything! We could be on TV and even--"
"Aww, don't worry honey, everything's going to be fine." She says, cutting you off.
"Ah?" You ask, looking her in the eye. "...anyway, we could be on those daytime talk shows and all I have to do is..."

This is when you become acutely aware that what is coming out of your mouth is not quite matching what you were wanting to say. You try again, now taking better care to listen to yourself.
"We beh be-rish mah! teebee tahshaow!"... "Teebee tahso... aaaaahhh." You place your hand over your face. "Of course you can't talk! You don't have that many teeth and it is hard to form words.

Your mom bursts out laughing. "Oh my you are the CUTEST thing! We could probably take you on one of those daytime talk shows for how adorable you are!"
"Wah!?" you shout.

That's when...
1111111.title: Two year old girl

111112.content:
"Mom, whats going on? I thought I heard a girl screaming.... Who are you!?" you heard a voice demand. Its Zoe with Ella right behind. Immediately you wince, since you didn't want them to see you like this. Especially right now.

"She is your brother" mom said.

"Yeah right. thats Jazz" Ella scoffed. Not that you blame them.

"Its true" you said, your eyes downcast. "I... I had an accident at the genetics facility I was visiting. Something splilt onto me. Mom, I still feel woozy." You stumble back and sit onto the toilet. Despite this, you can tell your sisters aren't buying it. Mom nodded though. "That explains it..."

"Explain what?" you said.

"Why the screams came here and not your room. How you didn't notice....." mom said, mercifully not continuing. You didn't need reminders of your changed state.

"Jazz. I'll help you get cleaned up. Ella. Zoe. I want you to get Jazz something to wear. I don't care what, or where you get it from. Just get Jazz something. Jazz will start to feel better with something on" mom ordered, as she pushed the girls away, and closed the door. You're too out of it to protest, or even think whathaving your sisters getting you clothes meant for you.

As you sit on your bed, your head began to clear and you started to realize the situation that you're in. That stuff they splilt onto you worked! It actually worked.... and it meant that you're a kid again, and worse, a girl.....

"Jazz. You okay?" mom asked concerned.

"Concidering..." you said, trailing off.

"The scientists? Did they say there is an antodote?"

"I.... I don't know" you said shaking your head. "Its all very experimental. How did it work!? I'm at four hundred times the weight of a normal lab rat. Maybe it can wear off...."

"Honey..." mom said, seeing your eyes filling with hope. Hope she felt in herself to be false.

"Think about it" you said excitedly. "Yes it affected me, but ...."

"Jazz. You'rre changed completely. Lets not become too optimistic" mom warned, as you started to hear the voices of your sisters, who are obviously arguing. Ella burst in first.

"Mom. the clothes up in the attic aren't right. Plus Jazz needs underwear. So I'm heading back to the mall. i'll be quick"

"They're right" Zoe countered.

"No, they're not" Ella argued as she rushed out. Zoe sighed and followed after her. You looked at mom in horror. the girls were arguing about what to dress you in.

A hour later, the girls returned with some clothes

After a while you hear your sisters return and soon you see Ella to your horror with a smug smile and carrying large pink shopping bags in that moment you knew who won the argument. After a moment Zoe comes into the bathroom with a look of defeat “Ella wants Jazz to come to our room” she said.

Your mother looks at you “go along Jazz follow Zoe” she says. “I think I’ll take James and some of his friends out for the day to break the news to him” she added.

“Ok” you say defeated as you go with Zoe.

Zoe and Ella’s room could best be described as “split” the twins being of complete opposites divided up the room as children everything in the room was painted white which the girls considered a neutral color but despite trying to be neutral it seemed that the girls only went to extremes to make their half of the room as opposite the others. Zoe’s side of the room was rather messy and her bed and half of the dresser she owned were labeled with aged stickers of super heroes, her walls were covered with posters of sports teams, her closet only contained one black dress she wore on special occasions everything else looked like it could have been Jasper’s at some point, and the pictures on the nightstand and dresser were mostly of a young Zoe playing sports, others were of her playing with friends, one however pictured her as a youth throwing water balloons at Ella. Ella’s half of the room however was at your current position frightening her objects had no stickers what so ever, her floors were completely dirt free something she took pride in, her walls had a few posters of artwork, her closet was an ever changing environment which contained practically nothing but dresses and skirts the few jeans she owned were what she called “bedazzled”, her pictures were of her as a child enjoying ballet or playing with her dolls, and at the makeup table (which comprised of and old office desk with a three way mirror looked like something an actress may sit at to get her makeup done) was Ella. “Oh there’s the little princess “said Ella happily as she ran over at hugged you Ella then turned to Zoe who was still angry about losing the argument “oh and look she’s brought Grumpy with her” she added.

“Ha, ha” said Zoe sarcastically as she grabbed her basketball.

“Where are you going?” Ella asked.

“I’m not going to watch you princessfy our big brother” said Zoe “I’m going out back to shoot some hoops” she said.

“Suit yourself” said Ella as she picked you up “but keep your ball out of my roses” she added.

“Yeah, yeah” said Zoe as she walked out of the room.

“Do you have to call me that?” you ask annoyed.

Ella giggled “I like sugar bear too” she said searching her purchases “or bubble buns” she added with a chuckle.

“Sweetie pie it is” you say crossing your arms in misery.

Ella giggles as she returns to you “legs up” she orders.

“You’re not going to diaper me are you?” you ask nervously.

Ella giggles again “no silly” she answered “I got you some big girl undies” she said holding up a pair of plain white panties.

“They’re not pink” you say surprised as you lift your legs up.

Ella giggled “no” she said as she put the underwear on you “I thought you would want to wear something a little plain first time around” she added.

“Oh… well… thanks” you say.

“You’re welcome” said Ella with a smile as she pulled up a pair of girls jeans with a bedazzled butterfly on the right leg but wasn’t as bad as you thought it would be the final piece was a red shirt with the message “cutie” and then a picture of a pie. “I don’t suppose I could persuade you to do your hair and nails?” Ella asked hopefully.

“No way” you respond simply.

“Come on I let you go easy on the clothes” said Ella. “Come on please?” she asks.

You decide to…

11111211211.title: you start crying

111112112111.content:
As we walked inside, I began to reflect on the effect my crying had. Hmm, I could take advantage of this. I wasn't that kind of guy... girl, but I figured it could come in handy if things went too far south.

As we continued to walk, Zoe got to the door first, opened, it and then immediately slammed it back and stood in front of it. "Heads up guys." she whispered. "James is inside."

"Oh, okay." Ella said casually.

"No, not okay!" I whispered in a panic. "If James was going to find out, it'd be on my terms. I was his rolemodel after all. He had to hear my side of it, and with Ella there, that would never happen.

"Zoe, you think you can distract him for a bit?" I asked.

"I don't really see how that would-"

PPleeaase, just do it. I promise I'll pay you back later." I said in desperation.

"Fine, but I won't forget that promise." She turned towards the door and quickly went inside before slamming it back.

"James!" I heard her say, a bit too enthusiastically. "Wow, fancy meeting you here. Hey, come on, let's go to that one place you've been wanting to go to." she said, voice getting quieter as she herded him away from the door and me.
"Wait, what place?"
"ya know, the place with the things and the--"
She was too far away to hear by now... but really. The place with the things? She really wasn't good at this. I turned to Ella who currently had her arms crossed.

"I don't get it. He's going to find out anyway." She said.

"Yeah, but I... it's just that...." I really couldn't find the words. I was finding it a bit hard to think straight. Was this the body having an effect on me or what?
Ella placed a kind hand on my shoulder.

"Don't worry Jazz. I know you're upset and embarrassed about it." She took my hand. "Come on, they should be far enough away by now for us to go inside."
Together, we qalked inside... Maybe Ella wasn't as bad as I first thought.

1111121121121.content:
There was silence in the room as the Geneticist, a balding man in his early fifties, poured over his notes. These were notes taken after his thorough examination of you earlier. He occasionally glanced at you before reading again. You fidgeted in your seat, impatient as you really wanted to know whether you will ever be your old self again. Mom looked worried but said nothing while the doctor read his notes. He finally paused and peering over the glasses perched on his nose, asked you, "How do you feel now young man?".

You were not sure how to answer that question. Clearly, you felt weird being a girl over these past twenty four hours but otherwise you did not feel any ill effects. "What does he really expect me to say?", you thought. You answered, "I feel just fine but I wanna know when I'll be myself again."

The doctor adjusted his glasses, looked back on his notes before answering, "I'm afraid we don't know the answer to that question, er son". "You see", he continued, "we don't know how strong the dose was and whether there will be any further regression before you start to age again..."

"No!", you screamed, "I wanna be myself again!". Mom interjected, "Surely you could do something in the meantime. Don't you have an antidote in case something like this happens?". The doctor walked over to the phone on his desk and pressed the intercom button, "Shirley, get me Doctor Hanson." He returned to you and your mom. "I need to discuss this with Dr. Hanson, our Senior Geneticist who can perhaps give you better answers than I can." You looked up to your mom who immediately asked, "How long do we have to wait for a definitive answer Doctor...?"

"...Blake, Dr. Blake." You suddenly realized that the doctor had not introduced himself earlier. "Dr. Blake", your mom continued, " will this mean more tests?"

Dr. Blake cleared his throat and replied, "Yes, perhaps your son will need to be here at the lab for a few days while we run some tests. They shouldn't be too much trouble..".

Dr. Hanson entered the room, "Vernon, I was in the middle of another experiment when Shirley called, this better be important...", he then noticed you and your mom, "Oh, hello folks." Before either you or your mom could respond, Dr. Hanson was talking to Dr. Blake again, "Alright, whats the problem here?".

Dr. Blake patiently explained the situation to Dr. Hanson. As the older man listened, Dr. Blake related what he had already told your mom and the possibility that you will need to be kept at the lab for tests.

Dr. Hanson turned to you, and you felt uncomfortable, much like a lab rat, as the Senior Geneticist closely scrutinized you from head to toe. Finally he said, "we will definitely need to keep the youngster here for a few days to test for any further effects. Until then, we can do nothing to change the situation."

"James, something happened to Jazz at the field trip yesterday and he is not here..."
"Oh for crying out loud!", you snapped, "James, I'm Jasper, your brother but I got turned into a little girl at the field trip!."
James eyes widened in disbelief.
"This is nuts!", he shouted, "I want to see Jazz now!"
You tried to assure him that you are his brother Jazz, and even with Mom and your sisters confirming that what you just said was true, James would have none of it.
"You are trying to prank me, but it won't work", James said, a hint of annoyance in his voice.
"Come on guys, honestly, where is Jazz?, demanded James.
"Bro," you started, but James shot you a mean look that stopped any further words from you.
Mom tried to calm him, "James, honey, I know you think we are joking and I truly wish we were. But as you can see, this little girl is really your brother Jasper."
James was still upset, "I am not dumb, so don't treat me like I am. Do you expect me to believe this?", he asked incredulously.
"Yes, James.", Mom replied with a sigh.
James sat subdued as Mom related the events that took place since the field trip ending with your visit to the Genetics Lab and what the doctors had to say.
After Mom was finished, James remained silent, as the reality of he just heard hit home. You waited anxiously, not daring to say anything else to upset your brother. Your sisters were equally anxious, both looking at James for any clue on what he is thinking. Mom tried to hide her anxiety as she looked at James, willing him to say something, anything.
Finally James ...
11111211211212112.title: ignore him

choices: James belives and give you a hug
1111121121121212.content:
Before mom could meet James, the phone rang. "Oh crap!", she muttered, exasperated. Mom picked up the phone from the wall by the main entrance.
"Hello?", she answered, as the door burst open and James entered followed by his friend's father with bags in hand. You ran into the room from the direction of your mom's bedroom, with your sisters in pursuit, "Jazz, get back here!", they both shouted.

Mom waved hello to James and his friend's father and signaled that she was on the phone, just give her a minute.
Mom on the phone, "Dr. Hanson, this is really a bad time for you to call and furthermore, if you expect me to come back to the lab for those tests of yours, forget it!"
You ran to your mom's side and held on to her arm, the girls stopped and look first at you beside mom, then at James, who was wide eyed in disbelief as he saw what was happening.

"Who is this?", he asked, but mom was still on the phone and could not answer. The twins pulled James aside to tell him. You were however more concerned about the phone conversation that mom was having. Of course, you could only hear her side of the conversation.
James' friend's father placed the bags on the floor and waved goodbye to Mrs. Storms, heading for the door. "Thank you", mom mouthed, as he opened the door and left.

"OK, Dr. Hanson, what the hell is this call about, and don't you bullshit me!", mom said tersely.
You could not help overhearing the attempts that your sisters were making to answer James' question, and his protests of disbelief.
Mom in the meantime was getting increasingly agitated on the phone as she listened to what appeared to you to be lengthy intervention by Dr. Hanson. Maybe he was trying to convince mom to return you to the lab for tests, you thought. You were relieved to realize that mom was not buying it.
"No Dr. Hanson!", mom said, "As I said earlier, I will not be returning Jazz to that lab. You told me already that you had no antidote, which by the way, I do not believe!"
Mom listened for a moment, just as James grabbed you hard by the shoulders, demanding an explanation of your presence in this house. You were startled, and you stuttered, "H-h-hey, you're hurting me!". You cried out, "Mom!"
Mom said quickly into the phone, "Dr. Hanson, I really have to go, but be assured that this is not the end of the matter as I will sue the shit out of you and your buddies at the Genetics Lab!" She then slammed the phone into its hook and turned to James.

"James Storms!, Let go of your brother this instant!"
James quickly let you go and looked aghast at your mother then at you.
"You all can't be seriously pulling this mean prank on me now are you?", he asked.
"James, honey," mom said, "I didn't want you to find out this way but you are looking at your brother Jasper."
"Bullshit!", James shouted, upset.
"Watch your language and tone, James Storms", mom said sternly.
"Mom, please tell me this is just a prank and that Jazz is in his room."
Mom signed in resignation and with tears streaming down her cheeks related to James the sequence of events since the field trip, ending with the phone call she just received. You were silent, waiting anxiously for mom to finish telling James the truth of what happened. Your sisters were equally anxious waiting to see James' reaction to this revelation.
James himself was silent, and quite subdued as the reality of what mom had said sank in. Your brother looked at you, the five-year old girl, and for a moment you feared that after all that was said, he still did not believe that you were his brother turned into a girl, and that you were nothing more than a fraud. You said, "James, it's really me and I wish it wasn't true but as you can see, it is."

.
1111121121121212.title: Before mom could meet James, the phone rings

11111211211212122.content:
At this point you expect James to freak out, or keep insisting it's a big lie, or maybe decide he must be dreaming. What you don't expect is for him to kneel down and hug you. Yet that's what he does.

"I'm sorry, man," he moans, his arms wrapped around your dainty frame a little too tightly for comfort.

"Aww, isn't that sweet?" Ella chirps in a tone that sounds a little too much like mockery for your taste.

"Shut up," you respond, barely able to turn your head enough to look at her. Still, James's embrace is comforting... at least until you realise you feel exactly like a little girl being comforted by her big brother. Then it's awkward. But you don't want to upset him by struggling to get away, so you rest your head against him and wait until he lets go and stands up.

An awkward silence ensues. James nervously shuffles his feet, not knowing what else to say to you, while you gaze warily at your sisters. After yesterday and this morning, you need a break from them.

"Come on, James," you say, leading him toward your room without further explanation. Zoe begins to follow you, but Mom holds out an arm to stop her.

"Eager to get away from those two?" James asks as you arrive in your bedroom.

"They've been a pain," you say. "They just fight over how to dress me and things."

"And... Ella's been winning, huh?"

You tug at your dress and sigh, seeing no need to answer the question.

"Come on, man. You're just letting her do that?" James asks.

"Well, what can I do about it?" you reply. "She won't listen to me. And... I don't want to upset her, I guess. She can enjoy this just a little while it lasts."

James turns his gaze away from you and gains an expression of concerned thought. He's probably wondering if you're going to be stuck this way, a possibility you still don't want to seriously consider.

"Mom seemed really angry at that guy on the phone," he eventually says, making you wonder what line of thought led him back to that.

"Yeah, she really flipped out when they wanted to keep me there," you say.

You spot Mom approaching your open door, and go out to talk to her.

"Mom," you say, "Do you... really think they could be withholding the antidote?"

Mom sighs. "All I know is I don't trust them. I really doubt whatever tests they wanted to do would actually help, and the fact that they let this happen in the first place... I have a hard time believing qualified scientists would be so careless. There has to be something shady about them."

You don't know whether to be encouraged by the prospect that there could still be an antidote somewhere, or discouraged by the idea of the scientists being untrustworthy.

"So... what are we gonna do?" you ask.

Mom decides to...
11111211211212122.title: James believes it

choices: Ask him to focus on the lab.
111112112112121222.content:
Mom, looking indecisive, doesn't answer your question, so you try another one. "Do you really want to sue them?"

You don't think you like the idea. It seems like it could result in a huge media circus centered directly on you, and the last thing you want is for the whole world to know what happened to you.

Mom seems to sense your apprehension. "... Maybe it would be rash to do that right away. We need to figure out what's going on in that lab." She pauses to think. "I know. I'm going to hire someone to find out for us."

"What, you mean a detective?" you ask.

"Oh, now there's a cool idea!" James says.

"Well, it seems like a safe enough thing to do," Mom says. "I'm sure you don't want to wait around, so I'll look for someone right away."

You watch her walk off, feeling increasingly uncertain about your fate. James notices your forlorn look and puts a hand on your tiny shoulder.

"Hey, you're gonna be alright, man," he says. "I'm here to help ya. How about I start by getting you some real clothes?"

"It's too late for that," you sigh. "I mean, I've already failed to make it through my life without wearing a dress. And Ella already bought a bunch of other things she wants me to wear. I don't intend to do anything else for her, though, so if she gets pushy..."

"Got it. You're safe with me around, bro."

You look up at James's resolute expression. As much you appreciate his sympathy, you're starting to see that he too has his own angle here. He seems eager to be the big brother and look after you, which may not be a bad thing, but you're a bit afraid of losing the respect he's always had for you.

"So, uh... you wanna go out and play ball?" he asks.

"I'd rather not," you reply, remembering what happened last time. The last thing you need is start crying in front of James. Also, a small part of you is complaining that you'd ruin your dress. You tell yourself, again, that you just don't want to upset Ella. After all, it's not like you couldn't have stood up for yourself when she picked this thing out for you, right?

"Fair enough," James says. "Play some games, then?" he asks, gesturing back into the bedroom.

"Sure," you say.

So the two of play video games for a while, an activity that almost manages to feel normal. Before too long, your mom pokes her head into the room.

"I got hold of a private investigator," she says. "He wants to come and see you."

"Oh... okay," you say, a bit nervously. You thought you could relax for a while, but you can't complain about progress.

You continue your game until you hear the doorbell. You exit your room, and Mom directs you to the living room. Ella and Zoe are standing there, and James comes in behind you. You climb up onto the couch and hear the front door opening, but still have to wait a minute or so before Mom comes into the room followed by a man in a black coat and jeans.

"So you're Jasper, huh?" the man says, moving to stand in front of you. "Harry Robertson, at your service. Your mom's told me about what happened to ya, but I wanna hear what you've gotta say." He turns to face Mom. "Alright if I have a little one-on-one with the kid?"

Mom nods and herds your siblings out of the room.

You stare up at this Harry and wonder if he actually believes your story. You study him, looking for signs he thinks you're crazy, but he has a pretty good poker face.

Finally, you decide you might as well just ask. "Do you actually believe...?"

"Ah, you reckon I must think you're all a buncha nutjobs, eh?" he says. "Well, I ain't rulin' it out, but lemme tell ya... I've had some weird cases before. Can't disclose 'em, but suffice to say that when I hear some guy's been turned into a little girl, it seems possible enough." He looks you up and down. "Gotta say, though, you ain't dressed like it bothers you."

Freshly embarrassed, you glance down at your girly attire and cringe before making your excuse. "It... makes my sister happy."

"Ha! Ain't that the sweetest. Well, don't worry, son. You won't be in skirts for long if I have anythin' to say about it."

You're not particularly reassured, but you do like that he called you "son" without hesitation.

"So tell me how this came about, then," he says.

"There's not much to say," you answer. "We were in that lab on a field trip, it was crowded, and I bumped into a shelf and that serum fell down and spilled on me."

Harry raises an eyebrow. "So they just had open containers of the stuff sittin' around?"

"Well... yeah, I guess."

"Suspicious," Harry says, rubbing his chin. "Very suspicious."

You don't like what he's implying. "What, you think they let it happen on purpose?"

"Could be it. Typical mad scientist behaviour. Never seems to occur to 'em they could look for willing test subjects."

Mad scientists? This guy seems a bit paranoid, you think, like some kind of conspiracy theorist. You suppose you have that attitude to thank for him believing you, but you wonder if he can really help.

"So what about that field trip?" he asks.

The question confuses you. "Uh... what about it?"

"Why'd they send you there in the first place?"

"Huh? It was for biology. The scientists talked about really interesting stuff. It's not like it was a waste of time."

You do, of course, still wish you hadn't gone.

"You don't know anything else?" Harry asks. "Can't tell me how or why it was set up?"

"Uh, no, not really," you say, giving him a funny look. Then you realise what he's thinking. "What, you think the school's in on it?"

"Well, maybe. Could be some shady dealings involved."

The idea seems a bit absurd to you. "I really don't think..."

"Start from the beginning, I say, and this begins at the school," Harry says. "Even if they weren't in on it, odds are good they know somethin'."

Your continued look of skepticism seems to discourage him a bit.

"Tell ya what, kid," he says, "Since you're the one in the middle of this mess, I'll let you pick where I start. I'd wanna look into how the trip was set up, but it's your call."
111112112112121222.title: On the case

1111121121121212222.content:
You tell Harry that you want him to investigate the lab, especally that Dr Hanson guy. He nods and quickly leaves, telling you that he will contact you soon.

"Surprised that detective actually believed you" James said as the two of you settled down for more video games.

"Me too. i know that lab is hiding something. And ever since he mentioned it, i can't stop thinking about how odd it was to have that serum unsecured in a lab" you said.

"Which lab?" James asked.

"Hanson's lab. Thats why i asked for him to be investigated" you said. "Plus there is something about that man. He's hiding something."

"Mad scientist? I thought they only found in here" James said, patting the console. Despite your situation, you smiled. "Yeah. Thanks for keeping the twins away from me."

James smirked slightly. "No prob errr ummm sis. Can't have them turning you into a mini-Ella, Jazz." You didn't know what to say. Instead you tried to focus on the video game, and beating James. Least you're still good at that. A hour later the phone rang, and you answered it. It was Harry.

"Kid. I've don't some searching and from what you've told me, your story is true" Harry said in his straight to the point manner.

"Yes, and what of this lab" you asked.

"They're nervous. I've got a recording about this Hanson talking to a Dr Blake. they're saying that the first accident they can deal with, but the second will cause trouble" harry said.

"i know they said they had a spill earlier" you said. "Mom was right. think you can investigate more and find out who was the victim of this spell?"

"i can try, but my current evidence suggests the victim was..."
1111121121121212222.title: Ask him to focus on the lab.

11111211211212122222.content:
...an intern who was only there for six months", Harry said. "You actually met him at the lab, as I recall. Funny thing though", Harry continued, "when I tried to reach him, I was told he no longer works there".

You were puzzled, "I know I saw the guy who said some of the stuff spilled on him, but it did not affect him."

Harry was silent and you thought for a moment that he may have hung up, but the line was still open. Your thought was broken by Harry's next words, "...ya know kid, if I could get an address, I would track down that intern and talk to him, see what else he knows."

"Couldn't you get that from the lab? How hard can it be?", you asked.

"let me level with ya kid", Harry said, "after what happened a while ago, that lab ain't gonna give me squat. I'll have to find another way in."

"By the way, which teacher at school had arranged this field trip?", Harry asked.

You thought for a moment. The truth was, you could not say for sure which teacher actually made the arrangements. You were however intrigued that Harry could have suspected that one of your teachers could shed light on this whole mess. You remembered that Miss Roper, your Biology Teacher had made the announcement about the field trip days before. You vaguely remembered that in her announcement, she had mentioned the name of another teacher who you were not familiar with. "What was the name again...?", you tried desperately to remember. It was a male, a Mr...., Mr...

"Kid..., you still there?", that was Harry. "Y-Yes", you answered, "I'm trying to remember the name of the male teacher who my Biology Teacher, Miss Roper said had made the arrangements. I just can't remember it."

"It's OK son, I'll just talk to Miss Roper. I'm sure she wouldn't mind giving me the name of the other teacher.", Harry said.

"Sounds good to me", you said, relieved.

"Alright, then, I'll go to the school tomorrow and speak to Miss Roper." With that, Harry hung up.

You turned to James, who was still playing a game on his portable gamer, "Up for another round?", you asked. The truth was, you wanted a distraction from all the heavy stuff that was happening and a game with James seemed like just the outlet you needed.

Just then, Mom walked in with milk and cookies, "you must be hungry after all of that excitement".

"Sure thing mom", said James, reaching for a cookie. You realized that in all the excitement, you had forgotten to eat and as if on cue, your tummy rumbled.
You eagerly reached for one of the glasses of milk and a cookie.

"So, what did Harry say?", mom asked.

You told mom about the missing intern and Harry's suspicion of one of your school's teachers. Mom's expression changed to one of worry.

"You think he's on the right track?", she asked apprehensively.

"I only hope so mom", you said, trying to reassure her. "Besides, who else should we suspect?"

Before Mom could reply, the phone rang again. She answered. You watched as her face went pale, and heard her blurt, her voice trembling, "Bastards...!"

You froze, "What could have ticked mom off like this?"

.
11111211211212122222.title: an intern

choices: one of the twins comes in
you decide to risk playing basketball again
111112112112121222221.content:
Mom stared at you wondering if she should say anything, but eventually she starting telling you (and James) what happened. "That Dr Blake was on the phone, in complete violation of my request of not contacting us unless they're willing to give me the antidote. He said they were completely aware of Harry's 'snooping' and they did not blame us..." You started to feel uncomfortable, fearing for Harry. You'd hate to have company.... Mom didn't notice your face and continued, "He then fed us some garbage about being completely open as their research isn't shut down. And the worst thing? He gave me a warning."

"What about mom?" you asked nervously. The biggest fear is that you're going to start talking, acting or thinking like a 5 year old girl. Mom turned to you, still furious, and said, "Both he and Hanson can give me or Harry the address of the intern, but i'm not going to like what I find. He said its best that I accept that there is no antidote, that there is no big conspiracy to turn highschoolers into little girls and move on with our lives."

You looked at mom. The idea of finding something you won't like is troubling, but you know mom. She won't stop until you're back to normal, or she is satisfied that those 'scientists' are telling the truth. "What now, mom?" you asked.

"I'm not going to have you two spend all day playing video games" mom said
111112112112121222221.title: Dr. Blake with a warning

choices: Stay put and hope he doesn't figure you out.
1111121121121212222211.content:
Before you can object to Mom changing the subject, Zoe hesitantly enters the room. "Jazz? Are you alright?" she asks.

"I'm... fine," you reply, not entirely truthfully.

"I was just saying that I don't want Jazz staying in here all day long," Mom says.

"But..." you begin, fully expecting to be cut off.

"Mom's right, Jazz," Zoe says. "You can't just stay cooped up in here for however long this is gonna take. We should go out and do something. You'll feel better."

"I don't wanna be seen like this," you complain.

"Oh, don't be silly. Nobody's gonna know it's you. We'll just say you're our cousin or something." Zoe's eyes wander to the plate of cookies beside you. "Is that all you've had to eat? That's it. We're taking you to the mall for a meal."

"I'm going too!" James somewhat aggressively declares, standing up. You apparently don't have a say in this.

"You guys are going out? Can I come too?" Ella asks, suddenly emerging behind Zoe.

"Oh, you just want to parade Jazz around now that you've dressed her up!" Zoe says.

You sigh quietly at the continued shift towards everyone referring to you as female.

"Aw, come on! Please?" Ella gives Zoe a pleading look for a second, then directs it at you instead.

"Fine, you can come," you say. "It's not like we're gonna let you try anything."

"Thank you!" Ella says. She prances out the door, then turns back and adds, "And I already spent my allowance, you know. So you're safe."

"Alright, you all go and have fun," Mom says, smiling. "And just leave everything to me, Jazz. Don't worry yourself."

Before long the four of you are making your way out the front door. Just as you leave, you notice Mom reaching for the phone. You hope she's not going to keep anything from you.

You follow your siblings down the street, feeling quite self-conscious and nervously looking out for anyone you know. James and Zoe, avoiding further discussion of your situation, start up a conversation about sports, but you're too distracted to pay much attention. Ella, meanwhile, just sort of admires your appearance the whole time. She seems to be biting her tongue, and whenever you glance up at her, she looks away. At least now she's trying not to annoy you too much.

You arrive at the mall's food court and, once your sisters get you your food, sit down at one of the tables. Zoe sits next to you, with James and Ella on the other side. The burger in front of you is your usual fare, but it looks a bit daunting to you now. Ella giggles when you pick it up and take a little bite from it, prompting you to give her an annoyed look as you start chewing.

"I'm sorry, but you're just so cute!" she says.

You grumble and idly scan the crowds until you spot your friend Nathan approaching the food court. You almost choke.

"That's Nathan over there!" you urgently whisper to Zoe.

"Hmm? ...So what?" she replies. "He's not gonna know."

"Zoe, he was on the field trip!" you say. "He knows that stuff spilled on me. If he sees me here with you guys, he's gonna figure it out!"

"I don't think so," Zoe says before taking a bite from her cheeseburger. "Even if he was there, who would believe it?" she asks with a full mouth, her lack of manners earning a glare from Ella.

"Nathan would!" you insist. "He really looks up to scientists like those guys... I'm sure he thinks it's possible."

Zoe looks thoughtful for a second. "Well... so what if he does find out? He's your friend, isn't he?"

This gives you pause, but you're not going to change your mind that easily. Friend or not, you can't help fearing how he might react.

"I just don't want this to leave the family, okay?" you say. "Besides, we're in public! What if he starts shouting?"

"Ah, calm down. Who says he's gonna come over here anyway?"

You watch as Nathan reaches the front of the line and starts making his order.

"He's ordering food!" you say. You frantically look around and take note of the two empty tables next to yours. "He's definitely gonna notice us!"
1111121121121212222211.title: Out and about

11111211211212122222111.content: You know you're got to hide, but where? Your first instinct is under the table, but even with your panicked state, you know you would be noticed, and the last thing you want is for Nathan to see you there like a frightened little girl. Plus it would not be a good look for James either, though you're too panicked to think about that. You looked up and saw a realistic option; in the middle of the food court, there is a play area designed to give little kids time to play. Of course that would mean you playing with it, along with other little girls who are playing with the equipment. You frowned at the thought Other little girls. No way you want to play with them, even though as Ella said, you'd be just another little girl
11111211211212122222111.title: Hide before Nathan sees you!

choices: Ella pursaudes the others to let you play
111112112112121222221111.content:
Quickly you rushed over to the equipment before James or the twins could stop you. Once you reached it, you looked back and to your relief, Nathan didn't look over towards you. Instead he noticed your brother and sisters and started walking towards them. Suddenly you had a unpleasant thought. What if they tell him that you're over here You know it would be bad. You stared at them for a few seconds, though nobody pointed in your direction. Okay, maybe they saw i freaked out and decided to play along you thought, though a part of you wanted to know what they, especially Ella was saying, the the strongest part just wanted to not be noticed. The last thing you want is for everyone at school to be talking about how Jazz got turned into a little girl.

"Whata wooking at?" a girly, childish voice asked. You spun around and saw the physical manestation of everything that you feared that Ella or even mom would eventually do to you. A girl your new age was standing nearby and you couldn't help but notice how pink her clothes were. Pink dress. Pink ribbons. Pink tights. Definately a girly girl.

"Seeing if my sister is coming to get me" you answered truthfully.

"Wanna play?" the girl asked.

You looked over and saw that Nathan, despite having a burger of his own, had decided to go off somewhere. "Sorry, but I think my sister is coming to get me" you said.
111112112112121222221111.title: run over to the equipment

choices: Ella talks to the girl's mother.
You get the heck out of there.
1111121121121212222211111.content:
To your relief, Ella stands up and walks over to you. You don't like the amused smile on her face, though.

"Jasmine, you have to finish your food before you can go play," she says in a condescending tone, as if you're a kid who can't follow instructions. You frown, but you know you brought this on yourself.

"Uh, okay, sis," you say, reluctantly playing along. Ella takes your hand and turns back toward the table.

"Aw. Come back after?" the little girl asks.

You hesitate, feeling a little bad for letting this kid down. "Uh..."

"We'll see," Ella says, clearly considering the possibility, before leading you back to your seat. As you climb into the chair, she snickers at you, looking like she's about to say something you won't like.

"Don't," you say.

"But you're making it so easy!" she replies between stifled giggles.

"She's right, you know," Zoe says. "If you want to keep your dignity, choosing little girls over your best friend isn't the way to do it."

You groan and get back to taking little bites out of your burger.

"We told Nathan you were sick," James says. "Which isn't totally false."

"Yeah," Ella says, "You certainly aren't feeling yourself!"

You do not find that funny, being quite scared of losing your identity. You glance back at the girl in the play area, then down at yourself. Although your appearance is plainer and far less pink than hers, it's still far too similar. You had better avoid coming to have anything else in common with her.

By the time you've eaten as much as you can, everyone else has finished. Just when you're about to urge them all to get moving, you notice the little girl talking to what is presumably her mother... and making gestures in your direction, having apparently taken considerable interest in you. Ella looks at the two of them with intrigue. It might be time to panic again.
1111121121121212222211111.title: Ella to the rescue?

11111211211212122222111111.content:
While you're certain that Ella is planning to make your life hell by planning a play date with this little girl, after hearing that Zoe and James's comments you're determined to remain still.

"Don't do anything" you hissed slightly as Ella got up and walked over the the girl's mother. After a quick almost inaudible conversation between herself and the girl's mom, Ella returned, a pleased look on her face. So did the girl, whom walked away with her mom.

"What did you do?" you asked alarmed.

"Lilith must had liked you" Ella giggled. "She begged her mom to come over to me and as if you can play with her."

"Please say you didn't" you begged, knowing that she just had. The idea of playing with a five year old girl is not at all appealing. Plus you can see it on her face she is thinking of princess dress costumes and other girlish torture devices.

"Ella, Jazz is going to get that antidote soon. What are you going to say then!" James demanded, sticking up for you.

"That won't be for a while' Ella said. "Besides she did run off and caught Lily's attention."

"Maybe, but you're enjoying this too much" Zoe said scornfully. Like always, it generated into a arguement between the twins. You crept closer to James. "James, i had no choice. Its hard enough for you guys to see me like this. I don't want my friends to see me as a 'widdle girl'."

James shrugged his shoulders. "You could had played along as if its a prank. Pretend that this hadn't happened and we got you as a prop."
11111211211212122222111111.title: Ella talks to the girl's mother.

choices: Call Harry with the news, He'll know what to do
111112112112121222221111112.content:
"It's getting late. We better get home now!", Zoe suddenly said. You were relieved. The thought of being pushed into play you don't really want was making you uneasy. "Yes, lets go home.", you agreed. Ella was disappointed. "Do we really have to go now?", she whined.

Zoe took your hand and resolutely pulled you with her toward the exit. James and Ella followed, Ella protesting that she was not ready and why do we have to go now when you were about to have fun. "Yeah, right", you said, "It's more fun for you Ella, but playing with little girls is torture to me."..

"And besides, what girlish games do I know?", you asked.

"Ooohhh, I could teach you loads of games", Ella said excitedly, not realizing that your question was rhetorical and you were not actually interested in learning any such games.

"I really want to get home now, I'm tired.", you said as you tried to keep stride with Zoe as fast as your little legs could carry you.

"Zoe, slow down!", you gasped, almost out of breath.

"Oh sorry, I didn't realize I am walking so fast", Zoe replied, slowing down enough for you to keep pace. You reached the section of the Mall where the taxis were parked and Zoe found a taxi going your way. You all piled into the taxi and began the journey home.

The four of you were talking and laughing excitedly as you walked toward the front door after been dropped off by the taxi. "Hey mom, we're back", James announced as he opened the door.

The moment you saw Mom, you knew something was wrong. "What's wrong Mom?", Zoe asked alarmed.

Mom's eyes were red and her face puffy from crying. "Kids, I have news that might not be good. We better sit down for this." You suddenly felt uneasy, and looked at the others to see whether they felt the same. Their anxious expressions was enough to tell you that your siblings were just as uneasy as you were.

"I should have done this before, I don't know why I didn't", Mom started. "After that phone call from Dr. Blake, I got to thinking about what his warning could have meant. Besides, I haven't heard from Harry since your last phone call with him, Jazz and I was getting really worried."

"Worried about what, Mom", you asked, your voice betraying a tremor of the fear you are beginning to feel. Ella and Zoe huddled closer on the coach as Mom continued, "I went online and did a Google search on that Genetics Center and I wished I didn't", Mom burst into tears.

After a few moments, Mom was more composed and she continued her news. As she spoke, the reality of what she was saying slowly sank in and you too began to cry. Zoe and Ella quickly held you to hush you. Even through your tears, you felt silly for being treated like a little girl by your big sisters. You were however too distraught to laugh at the funny irony of this thought.

The gist of Mom's discovery was that the Genetics Center had been experimenting with human subjects long before they got approval to experiment with lab animals with the youth serum. It is now under investigation for unethical practices after the disappearance of three young men, around your former age, from two states. Investigators were however no closer to the truth as no sign of the young men were ever found. The investigation is five years old as the first reported disappearance occurred around that time. Then there is the intern, who according to news on the web, has been reported missing from home and has not yet been found. Speculations are that he may have been kidnapped or worse, killed. Mom, however reminded you of Dr. Blake's warning about not liking what you may find out about the intern, suggesting that he may possibly still be alive. "But in what condition?", you thought.


"What are we going to do now?", James asked. The very question you were about to ask Mom.


.
111112112112121222221111112.title: you're taken home

1111121121121212222211111121.content:
"Let's wait until tomorrow", Mom said, "I think we have had enough action for one day." You agreed and the others were similarly in agreement that it's best to wait.

For the rest of the evening things in the Storm's household was as normal as they could get, under the circumstances. Mom retreated to her home office to catch up on work that was being neglected, Ella took you, protesting of course, to her room to listen to some music. At least listening to music was better than pouring though her fashion magazines, or worse yet, playing with her huge Barbie doll collection. James and Zoe went outside to shoot hoops, until it became too dark to continue.

You were the first to wake up the next day. Truth was, you had a restless sleep during which you had a bad dream about being chased by mad scientists bent on experimenting on you some more. You vaguely recalled at one point during the night, Mom coming into your room, and cradling you in her arms, rocked you back to sleep. "Man, that was one weird dream, I hope I'll never have again", you said to yourself, as you made your way to the bathroom to brush your teeth.

Soon, you heard signs of the others stirring. Today will be an interesting day, you thought.

Everyone was having breakfast when the doorbell rang. James got up and went to the door, it was the detective Harry Robertson.

"Hey folks", Harry said cheerily, as he walked past James and immediately plunked himself on one of the couches in the living room.

"Sorry I didn't call first Mrs. Storms, but I think I should come here first thing to tell you the news I've got..."

Mom got up from the table and made her way toward the other couch ; "It's OK Harry, I also have something to tell you which may help the investigation."

Harry was interested, "What is it Mrs. Storms?", he asked.

Mom related the story of her web search and the disturbing news about the Genetics Center it revealed.

Harry was stunned, "You sure about this?", he asked.

"I really don't know what to think", Mom replied, "I already do not trust those doctors, so to think that they may be capable of...", she trailed off.

Harry thought for a moment before he pulled out a notebook from his pocket and leafed through it.

"I wanna tell you Mrs. Storms that I did some more diggin' at the lab and I must tell you, nobody wants to talk.", Harry said while examining his notes.

"It's as though the Youth Serum Project never existed. Everyone I spoke to denied that they know anything about any research with a youth serum. Fact is, I couldn't ever get any further leads on that intern, its as if he doesn't exist..."

It was Mom's turn to be stunned, "Don't tell me the lab is covering up its tracks!", she said, dismayed..

Harry hesitated, "er, It would seem that way. I'm really meeting a roadblock here. But I did get an interesting tip from one of the janitors at the lab." Harry paused. Everyone in the room looked at Harry in anticipation, as though his very next words will contain the lifeline.

"The janitor told me that he overheard the two doctors, er Blake and Hanson, talking about one of their experiments gone wrong. Of course, he couldn't tell me whether it was the youth serum experiment. What he did tell me though was that this was not the first time something went wrong with experiments at that lab."

You were getting nervous as you heard all that was being said and you wondered whether you could have been included in that experiment gone wrong. It suddenly dawned on you that the antidote must be found quickly if you were ever to return to your normal self.

Harry got up to leave, "I'll just have to continue diggin', and find that intern. I'll also check out that website for you seeing that if it is true that there is an investigation into that lab, there will be a paper trail I can follow."
1111121121121212222211111121.title: Nothing, wait until tomorrow

1111121121121212222211111122.content:
Quickly, you headed off to your room and called Harry. After hearing what mom had to say, you're suddenly worried about him. You dialed his number and waited, growing more impatient with every second. Finally you got through.

"Hi kid. Guess you want to know what I had been trying to find. The intern is a tweenage girl that is a little shy, but i think..." Harry's rough and direct voice answered. You exhaled a sigh of relief firstly that he is talking to you, and secondly that his voice had no sign of stress.

"Yeah. Glad you're okay, especially after what mom told me. She did some research while i was at the mall" you said, instantly regretting telling him you was at the mall, since you had no desire for him to know Ella had set you up on a play-date. Fortunately he didn't ask. "Go on.."

"Mom googled about the lab and found that they've been doing human experimentation!" you blurted out. "The investigation is five years old and with three people!."

"I see. I rarely trust the internet for investigation since its too easy to plant false data" Harry said. You shook your head, wondering how he gets anything done. "Okay kid, i'm going to take a look... I see..." Harry said after a few minutes.

"What?" you demanded, as you had a sinking feeling.

"See the page, kid? No references to any papers or any other forms of media. Plus the date this page was added was today" Harry said.

"What?!" you yelled. It was enough for James to come into your room. He seemed a little relieved it was still untouched, considering everything Ella had done. "What does that mean? Why would anyone put such a page up?'

"i don't know kid. I'll get back to you..."

"Wait" you cried, but he had already ended the call
1111121121121212222211111122.title: Call Harry with the news, He'll know what t...

choices: Ella wants to take you to Lilith's house.
11111211211212122222111111221.content:
You stare at the phone in your hand, annoyed at Harry for hanging up on you like that. Now you wish you had listened to him when he picked up. He said the intern had become a girl, but that doesn't add up. That spill was supposedly a month ago, but you saw the guy just two days ago, seemingly unchanged.

With a sigh, you put the phone down and head over to your computer - you have to stand in the chair to use it - to find the web page Mom was talking about. It looks pretty convincing, but sure enough it's dated today and has no references. You hope Harry is right about it being a fake, even if it doesn't make much sense to you.

Well, there's nothing else you can do right now. You surf the web for a bit, and chat a little with your online friends. At least they're none the wiser. Eventually you go to bed early, hoping things will be clearer tomorrow.

You wake up the next morning (Sunday) to find yourself alone in your room. Odd; you're usually up before James. You get out of bed and open up your wardrobe. With no meddling sisters around you can dress yourself today, but you don't like your options. The little jeans Ella bought for the sake of "going easy on you" are in the laundry, and there doesn't seem to be anything comparable in the row of girly outfits incongruously displayed next to your old clothing.

You don't bother trying to decide which choice will cost you the least dignity, since that would only worsen tomorrow's options (you have to admit you're not likely to be changed back today). You end up wearing a purple shirt, a matching skirt and black tights.

As you exit your room, you anxiously wonder what developments await you today.
11111211211212122222111111221.title: The third day

choices: "Sure, I'd like to be a guy again. But it's not gonna happen."
111112112112121222221111112212.content:
Before you can find anyone, you hear the doorbell ring. You watch as Mom opens the door and is met with a nervous looking girl of around 12, dressed in a mildly feminine manner.

"Who are you?" Mom asks.

"Oh, ah, hello," the girl stutters. "I, well..."

Suddenly remembering you don't want to be seen, you try to get out of the girl's sight, but your movement ends up catching her attention. "Oh! You... are you, uh, Jazz?" she asks.

You gasp. How does she know your name?

"Oh, I'm sorry," the girl says. "We shouldn't talk right here... um, can I come in?"

Mom eyes the girl suspiciously, but allows her inside and closes the door. The three of you enter the living room to find Ella, Zoe and James already there, looking very curious.

"Again, who are you?" Mom demands.

"I'm... well, the other victim," the girl says. "My name's Lisa Brown... er, formerly Liam, that is."

You stare up at her. "You... so you were the intern?"

Lisa releases her held breath and relaxes, relieved that you know what she's talking about. "Yes. I was working there when I was exposed to the youth serum, and I ended up like this. That was about a month ago."

"A month ago... that means that guy at the lab was lying?"

"So they did have someone pretending to be me?" Lisa asks. "You know... I believed everything they told me at the time. That it was an accident, there was no cure... but now, after talking to that detective, I just don't know anymore..."

The room goes quiet. You ponder what questions you should ask until Zoe breaks the silence with, "So why did you come here?"

"I guess I just wanted someone I could talk to," Lisa says. "It's been hard, trying to blend in as a girl... I'm always worried people will find out the truth, or I'll do something all wrong and everyone will think I'm weird..."

"So... you've been going to school?" Ella asks.

"Hey, yeah, I think I've seen her around," James says.

You shudder. No way are you going through school all over again as a girl. You'd better start figuring things out so you can avoid that fate.

"What do you know about that web page?" you ask.

"... I saw a page like that about a week after I changed," Lisa says. "But the next day, it was gone. I convinced myself they deleted it because it was wrong, but... I guess it could be a cover-up..."

Mom, with a renewed determination in her eyes, puts a hand on Lisa's shoulder. "Don't worry. We'll get to the bottom of this and make those bastards take responsibility for what they've done."

"...I don't know about that," Lisa says. "If there's really some big conspiracy here... I don't want to get involved. I should just put my old self behind me..."

"But they could still have an antidote somewhere!" James says. "Don't you want to try and find it?"

Lisa sighs. "Well..."
111112112112121222221111112212.title: Someone rings the doorbell

choices: The twins take Lisa to the mall, but drops you off at Lilith's house

"...I'd much prefer to be an guy again.... but that's not going to happen" Lisa sighed, hope fading from her face again.

"Why?" mom asked. lisa sighed. "I worked there remember. We were working on a drug designed to repair damage at the genetic level. Every thing exposed to the drug, animal or human has turned female."

You felt like crying, hearing this. Was this the warning that you'd find something you won't like? That your hopes are crushed...

"This page that was posted, then taken down. Can you remember anything from it?" mom asked.

"Not really. The story was the same, but the timings were different. i think it said for me that it was five and a half years, meaning it was before it said it happened for you" Lisa said.

"Maybe if you can find who posted the webpage, you can find out what's going on' James said.

Lisa started tearing up. "It could be anyone. Scorned employee. Someone feeling guily about me, then Jazz, and wants to stop the research..."

"Or someone trying to tell the truth" mom countered. "there is still the covering up the whole you're missing thing." Lisa nodded. 'i just don't know what to do."

"I can take you to the mall, if you want" Ella said, perking up. You felt like grinding your teeth. but least it means she forgetting about you and Lilith.

"No way. She would be better off with me. or James" Zoe countered. You shook your head. The twins arguing...
1111121121121212222211111122121.title: hope renewed?

11111211211212122222111111221211.content:
You groaned in dismay as it became clearer that Ella was having the upper hand over Zoe in their argument for you. Ella was determined to get her way this time and did not allow Zoe to persuade her to abandon her idea to take you and Lisa out. Finally, Zoe relented, "Alright, we go to the Mall."

"Yeah, great, lets go!", Ella said, excited. You still didn't want to go and you tried to appeal to your sisters to change their mind, but too late, as Ella was already pulling you toward your room to get you dressed for the Mall.

Later Ella entered the living room, beaming while you followed, reluctantly, all dressed in a mostly pink little number to go to the mall. You fidgeted in discomfort as you hated this frilly, floral pattered dress. Where the hell did Ella get this from? you wondered. Zoe soon came out, a little miffed that she has lost another argument with her twin and being forced on another trip to the mall. "OK, lets go and get this over with", Zoe muttered to her sister.

With that, you all headed to the door. "Be careful now", Mom called out as you left.

Soon you arrived at the Mall where the twins left Lisa. "See you later, Lisa", they said.

You followed the twins as they continued toward Lilith's house. You became alarmed, as you did not want to be left with Lilith and her mom. "Hey, you didn't say we would be going o Lilith's", you protested.

"Oh don't be a sourpuss", Ella said with a smile, "you will have fun with Lilith."

At Lilith's house, Ella rang the door bell and waited.

The door opened and...
.

1111121121121212222211111122122.content:
You stare at Lisa disbelievingly, feeling somehow betrayed. James and Zoe seem as incredulous as you, but Mom and Ella just look thoughtful.

"...What?" Lisa says. "I-I mean, it's not the end of the world... I don't think it's worth risking... I mean, there's nothing really wrong with being a girl, is there?"

She looks around nervously, reading everyone's expressions.

"Okay, fine, I like it!" she half screams, arms outstretched. "I like looking pretty and being one of the girls!"

Then she freezes, seemingly as surprised as anyone else by her own outburst. "...I've never admitted that before..."

Well, so much for someone to share your misery with.

"I'm sorry," Lisa says, noticing your dismayed look. "You don't feel that way, do you? I guess I'm not much help..."

You look over at Ella, who is no longer hiding her mirth. "You wanna do something for me?" you say. "Keep her busy."

Ella takes that as her cue to grab Lisa by the arm and declare, "You and I are gonna get along just fine!"

With that, a very flustered-looking Lisa gets dragged out of the room.

"Well, that was weird," James says. "At least you got Ella off your back for a while."

"Yeah, but I think this is just gonna encourage her..." you reply.

"Hey, don't we still need to talk to that girl?" Zoe asks.

"I suppose she's already told Harry everything she knows," Mom says. "Anyway, now that Jazz is up, I should make breakfast."

11111211211212122222111111221221.content:
As Mom walked to the kitchen to make breakfast, Harry came to the door. "hello guys", he said cheerfully. Everyone in the room returned his greeting. Mom stopped and turning to Harry said, "I'm so glad to see you after the scare with that website, I really hope you will get to the bottom of this mess so that we can get on with our lives."

"Rest assured Mrs. Storms, I'm looking at all the leads I can to make sense of all that's happening.", Harry grinned. "Just so you know, I had a buddy of mine, a real techie, trace the origin of that website and he told me that the Genetics Lab had many enemies since the research they are doing is real ground-breaking stuff."

"That's interesting Harry but I still don't understand why someone would go out of their way to put up such lies...", Mom said. You looked at Harry who was leafing through a dogeared notebook he took from his pocket.

"As I noted here, it seems that a rival lab doing similar research, without much success I would say, had placed that website up to discredit the Genetics Lab. A complaint was lodged, presumably by the Genetics Lab, and the web hosting company took the site down.", Harry explained.

"Well Mrs. Storms", Harry said, a little hesitantly, you noticed. "I did speak to the intern, who told me all he..er.she knows, which isn't much more than we know already "

Just then, Ella and Lisa returned to the room. Harry was surprised to see Lisa as he did not expect to see her at the Storms. "H-Hi there Lisa", Harry said. Lisa's reply was barely audible. Ella turned to Mom, "Hey Mom, can I take Lisa and Jazz out later?"

Mom thought for a few seconds before answering. You however were not really keen on going anywhere with Ella or Lisa. You were more interested in Harry's investigation and what else he could find out. You asked, "Harry, can you find out whether the lab really has an antidote?"

Harry answered...

111112112112121222221111112212211.content:
"I snuck back into the genetics building... and I got my hands on this," Harry says, producing a vial of blue liquid from his pocket. "Now, don't get too excited, 'cause I don't really know what this is. Had to skedaddle before I could figure it out. But the notes I saw looked promising."

He turns to Lisa. "Hey, since you're here, what do you make of this? Look familiar at all?"

"Oh, uh..." Lisa hesitantly takes the vial and examines it closely. "I don't think I've ever seen this... what did the notes say?"

"Ehh, something about... cellular acceleration or somethin' like that," Harry says. "It was pretty vague. I get the feelin' they didn't want to write too much down."

You wonder if that could be accurate, or if Harry just didn't understand the notes and is being paranoid.

Lisa gently shakes the vial back and forth, watching how the liquid moves. "I guess it could be related to the youth serum, but... without laboratory equipment, there's no way to really tell..."

"Figured as much," Harry grunts. "And I don't know who we could trust with it..."

"Maybe we could find an animal to try it on?" Zoe suggests.

"No way! That's awful!" Ella snaps.

"Well, hey, you know chemistry, don't you?" James says to Lisa. "Could you figure it out if you had the stuff?"

"Um... Well, I..." Lisa looks down at you with sad eyes and takes a deep breath. "I guess if I could get hold of some equipment at school, I could do a few tests... it wouldn't be conclusive, but..."

"Oh! I can help!" James says. "We'll sneak into a science classroom after school, and I can help you!"

Lisa looks at James curiously. "Well... what can you do?"

"I'll... guard the door for you?" he offers.

She gives him a blank look for a second, then smiles. "Thank you."

You cringe at James's dorky interaction with Lisa. You hope he's just eager to help for your sake, because it almost looks like he's crushing on this guy-turned-girl. That would be a million kinds of awkward.

"Harry?" Mom says. "Are we going to let these kids...?"

With a start, Lisa turns to face Mom. "O-oh, if you don't think it's a good idea, it's alright..."

Harry puts a hand to his chin. "...You just be careful with that stuff."

"I will," Lisa sighs. She slips the vial into her pocket, keeping her hand close to it. "Well, I suppose I should be going..."

Lisa heads for the front door, but Ella chases after her. "Hey, don't go yet! We should do something together. Why don't we take Jazz and go to the mall?"

You shake your head. Going to the mall seems to be Ella's answer to everything lately.

"I-I'm not going all over town with this stuff!" Lisa objects. "I need to take it home! ...And put it somewhere very safe!"

"Oh. Well, can I come over?" Ella asks.

Lisa looks surprised. "I... yeah. Yeah, sure."

The two of them leave, Ella apparently being more interested in her new friend than in getting breakfast. You'll have to thank Lisa later - both for taking risks to help when she doesn't actually want the antidote herself, and for somehow getting Ella to leave the house without you.

11111211211212122222111111221221122.content:
Dr. Hanson from the Genetics Center stood at the door. James, of course did not know who he was. "Who are you?", he asked, suspiciously. You entered the room just in time to hear James' question but stayed out of Dr. Hanson's sight. Dr. Hanson smiled. There was something about this tall, gray haired man, dressed in a neat gray suit that just did not sit right.

"Never mind that, young man, I'm here to see your mother about unfinished business", he replied condescendingly, "Is she home?"

You glanced at James who looked as though he would have slammed the door in Dr. Hanson's face, but just then, Mom walked in from the kitchen. "Who is it James?", she asked.

Before James could reply, Dr. Hanson answered, "Just me, Mrs. Storms, Dr. Hanson".

Mom's tone changed instantly to one of subdued anger, "What are you here about Dr. Hanson?", she asked icily.

Dr. Hanson replied, "Mrs. Storms, you really don't need to get your defenses up, all I am here to do is to talk..."

Mom's anger rose, "We have nothing to talk about Doctor. I suggest that you leave my house now..."

Still standing at the door, Dr. Hanson looked uncomfortable as he tried to contain his own frustration with this obvious barrier placed by your mom. "I know you have something of ours and we want it back.", he said through gritted teeth.

Mom strode to the door and for a moment you thought she was about to physically tackle this much taller man, "You really expect me to just hand over whatever you think I have for you?", she asked incredulously.

"Mrs. Storms, allow me to come inside and explain everything...", Dr. Hanson began but Mom cut him off, "Please leave!"

"All I need is to retrieve the vial I know you have and nothing bad will happen to you." Dr. Hanson said, in a soothing voice. You did not like the sound of that at all. Mom, sensing the threat in those words, said, "I really must insist that you leave, before I call the cops"

There was silence for a moment before Dr. Hanson replied, "I know you think you have the antidote that would help your son return to normal, but let me assure you that if you use that liquid, your poor son will regress even more..."

"What?!", Mom could barely contain her disdain for this man. "I know what you are trying to do, but it won't work!"

Dr. Hanson adopted a hard line, "Mrs. Storms, get me that vial now! You really don't know how volatile this liquid is. If you use it, your son will be reduced to a newborn and there will be nothing you can do to reverse this. LET ME HAVE THAT VIAL!"

Mom replied calmly, "You won't get it because I don't have it."

"Where is it?", Dr. Hanson asked, his voice a little more subdued but still carrying an edge to it. You stepped into view and Dr. Hanson immediately remarked, "Good to see that your son has not regressed further since our last encounter, Mrs. Storms, at least he still has his faculties about him, for now..."

"What is that supposed to mean?", Mom asked, her voice betraying the fear and anxiety creeping up on her.

Dr. Hanson cleared his throat before speaking, choosing his words deliberately, "It simply means, Mrs. Storms, that the youth serum is volatile and highly unpredictable. As each day passes without an antidote, subtle changes in your son's mental capacity and his behavior will occur."


Mom was flabbergasted. You, James and Zoe stared at Dr. Hanson in disbelief. What is he trying to say?, you thought. You had a sinking feeling that whatever else Dr. Hanson had to say won't be pleasant.

As if reading your mind, Dr. Hanson continued in a smooth voice belying his seething anger at your Mom's stubborn refusal to cooperate, "At first, the changes will be minor, like forgetting little things, not enjoying foods you used to like, a little slurring of speech, nothing to really be alarmed about. But, the longer he goes without "treatment" the more drastic the changes will become until finally, his condition will become irreversible and your son won't be your son anymore..."

You did not like what you were hearing and you could not help blurting, "Does this mean I won't ever be myself again?"

Dr. Hanson smiled, "Of course you will be normal again, as long as you do what I say and hand over that vial..."
11111211211212122222111111221221122.title: Dr. Hanson

choices: Ella comes home a few hours later.
111112112112121222221111112212211221.content:
Dr. Hanson looks at you, expecting a response, but you just stand there frozen, holding back tears.

"Well then?" he asks. "Why don't you just come with me and we can get this all sorted out?"

"N-no..." you mutter, backing away from him.

"Dr. Hanson," Mom says sternly, "We were told you didn't have an antidote."

Dr. Hanson almost seems to falter. "Well, it's not that simple. We need to analyse the effects before we can devise..."

"You are not touching my son," Mom growls. "And I told you, we don't have this vial of yours."

Dr. Hanson gives a thoughtful, hard-faced stare. "Fine," he venomously intones. "But you're only wasting precious time. I'm sure I'll see you again before long. Until then, try not to make things any worse for yourselves."

You breathe a sigh of relief as he turns and leaves, slamming the door behind him.

"Do... do you think he could be telling the truth?" you shakily ask of no-one in particular.

After a few seconds, James is the one to answer. "Nah, you'll be okay, Jazz. I mean, Lisa was fine, right?"

"What if she's not, though?" Zoe says. "We don't know what she was like before! What if her brain did change, and that's why she doesn't want to change back?"

"We need to talk to her," you say, wiping your eyes and reaching for the phone.

"Jazz..." Mom reaches out to stop you, but you ignore her. You know she'd rather make the call herself, but you really need whatever semblance of control you can get right now. You take the phone and dial Ella's cell phone.

"Hello?" she answers.

"Ella! I have to talk to Lisa!" you say.

"Huh? Okay, I'll put her on..." Ella says, sounding a bit worried by your urgent tone.

After a few seconds, you hear Lisa's voice. "Hello?"

"Lisa! Dr. Hanson was just here!" you say.

"What?!" she cries, sounding ready to panic already. You hear Ella saying something inaudible in the background.

"He was saying my mind is going to change," you say. "Is that true?"

"Huh? I-I..." Lisa stutters.

"Do... do you think that's happened to you?" you ask.

Lisa is silent for several seconds. "No... no, that can't be right, it can't..." she mutters, sounding like she's talking to herself more than you.
