You have to ask something else just to keep her talking. "He said I would forget things and be more like a kid... do you think it's possible?"

"...It could be," she says, her voice shaking. "I don't think I've changed... not much, at least, but... you got a much higher dose than I did. It's possible it had a subtle effect on my brain, and could be much harsher on yours..."

That's not what you wanted to hear. You sigh deeply before remembering what else Dr. Hanson had said. "He also said the stuff in that vial would..." you begin.

"He knows we have it?!?" Lisa interrupts.

"He knows it was taken," you say, trying to sound reassuring. "He doesn't know it's with you."

A whimpering sound informs you that you haven't exactly calmed her down.

"Listen, he said if I took it, it would regress me to a newborn. Can you find out if that's right?"

"...Okay," Lisa says through a deep breath. "Okay, I can do that. I'll just need a microscope, and I can test its effect on blood cells..."

"Thank you," you say. Then you hear Ella's voice again.

"Jazz? What was..." she trails off, and you hear a faint sobbing. "Never mind. I'm going to stay with Lisa for a while, I think she needs me... I'll see you later."

She hangs up, and you try not to start crying yourself.
111112112112121222221111112212211221.title: He's bluffing. You hope.

choices: Mom drops you off at Lilith's house
1111121121121212222211111122122112211.content:
A few hours later, Ella came home, looking like she's seen a horror movie. You was distrubed seeing her like this, since she is far to girly to watch anything like that, and that you know she must had been experimenting with Lisa with the antidote. 'Mom, whatever you do, don't give Jasmine thta antidote."

"What? You just want to have someone to girlify" James said, from upstairs. He could hear perfectly, but he couldn't see how distressed Ella looked.

"You don't understand! Lisa and I tested some of the antidote on some of my skin cells after you called" Ella wailed.

"What happened?" you asked. "I'm going to fully turn into a little girl if i don't get an antidote." Ella didn't answer. Instead, she turned around, exitted out the front door and vomitted.

"It has to be bad if what she had seen has caused Ella to react like that" Zoe said to James. Both of them had come downstairs in time to see Ella's very unfeminine act into her rose garden.

"What happened?" mom asked five minutes later, as she sat a pale looking Ella on a chair.

"Lisa scrapped a few of my skin cells into a dish a poured a tiny amount of the antidote on them. She then looked at them with a microscope a-and... it was horrible! J-Jasmine. Jazz, promise me you won't ever touch this stuff."

But what does it do? you wondered. "So what now?" you asked.

"We try and find out if that bastard is telling the truth about you thinking like a kid" Zoe said. Mom and James looked at each other.

"But how? That guy has been lying to me the entire time" you said. "What makes you feel like he has finally decided to be honest?"

"You seemed concerned enough" James said. You reluctantly nodded, though none of them answered your mental change question. You decided to press them for an answer."But how? I can't see James wanting to play 'tea party' with me?"

"No" mom said. "But I think I know how..."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211.title: Ella's horrifying news

11111211211212122222111111221221122111.content:
"You do have someone to play with, remember?" Mom says. She turns to Ella. "What was her name... Lilith?"

You tense up. You didn't know Mom had been told about that, and you'd kind of hoped it had been forgotten after everything else that happened today.

"Mom, you're not going to...?" you say.

"What? It was your idea to try playing," she says.

"Well, I mean... I didn't..." you stammer.

Mom sighs. "Jazz, I know you don't want this, but... we need to try something, and Ella already set this up. We might as well see it through."

You groan and reluctantly nod.

"Good," Mom says. "I'll drop you off at the girl's house and..."

"Drop me off?" you interject. "You're gonna leave me there by myself?"

Mom seems to carefully consider her response. "Listen, honey... I don't want you to worry about embarrassing yourself. Whatever you do while you're there, none of us have to know about it, alright?"

"Okay..." you reply, a little confused.

"Now then... do you have their number, Ella?"

Ella, still looking a little nauseous, just nods and gives Mom her phone.

"I'll phone ahead and we'll get going right away," Mom says. She walks out of the room, and you're about to follow her when Ella finally speaks.

"Jazz... I hope you..." She pauses, a pained look on her face. "Oh, I don't know what I hope for... I just want this to be over, one way or another..."

You know things have gotten bad when you're off to play with a little girl, and Ella isn't the least bit happy about it.

You soon leave with Mom, who holds your hand the whole way to Lilith's house, making more of an effort to look natural than your siblings did when they took you out. Once you arrive, Mom knocks on the door and is promptly answered by Lilith's mom.

"Hi!" she cheerfully greets you. "You must be Mrs. Storms. Thank you for coming."

"It's nice to meet you, Mrs. Parker," Mom replies.

"Please, call me Elizabeth."

Mrs. Parker kneels down to talk to you. You're briefly relieved to be at eye level with someone before logic kicks in and you feel patronised.

"Hello, Jasmine!" she says. "Oh, you look a bit shy. It's okay, I don't bite!" She stands up and addresses your mom again. "I'm so glad to find someone to play with my little Lily. We've just been here a few weeks, you know, and she's been a bit lonely..."

Hearing this, you feel a little guilty... or at least, you hope you have reason to feel guilty.

"Lilith!" Mrs. Parker shouts into the house. "Your new friend is here!"

Lilith emerges from a doorway and lights up at the sight of you. "Yay! Jasmine!"

"Well, I'll be back in an hour or two," Mom says, giving you a gentle push inside. "You two have fun."

Mom leaves, and as soon as the door closes behind you, you realise she definitely had some sort of point about leaving you here alone. With nobody around who knows who you really are, you suddenly feel less like a teenage boy in a little girl's body and more like a little girl with the mind of a teenage boy.

You follow Lilith into her room. Your first thought is that it's huge, but that might just be the effect of seeing a new place from your current perspective. The room is decorated in line with Lilith's dress sense and features an abundance of dolls and stuffed animals scattered around. You get the impression that she's a bit spoiled... and also very girly, but you knew that.

"Tea party!" Lilith gleefully declares, walking over to a child-sized table. "What dolly you like?"

After a moment's hesitation, you grab one of the nearby dolls and begin your attempt to act in a way befitting your appearance.
11111211211212122222111111221221122111.title: The playtime experiment

choices: Another play date for five year old Jazz
Sixteen Year old Jazz regains control
111112112112121222221111112212211221111.content:
You tentatively handled the doll you had picked, not sure how to play with it. Besides, this is the first time you have ever played with dolls and you were not sure you were doing it right. Lilith had also picked out a doll and was busy cooing with it as if it were a living child, "want some tea now bubbles?" she asked the doll. You watched her manipulate the doll to give her an affirmative nod. "Good, here you goooo...", she cooed as she pretended to pour some tea into the doll's cup.

You figured that this was the way to do it and followed Lilith's example, "Want some tea, er, er, Dolly?, you asked.

"Her name's Candy", Lilith corrected you.

"Oh, OK. Want some tea Candy?", you asked as you took the teapot and unceremoniously pretend dumped the tea into her cup.

"No, No, No!", cried Lilith, "You have to pour nicely or she won't drink it. She don't like it when you're rough on her..."

Oh for crying out loud, you thought, its only a doll! You instead meekly said, "S-Sorry, Candy, here you go...". You blushed in embarrassment as you realized that you just apologized to a doll.

The play continued with you and Lilith fussing over your dolls and even sharing talk, doll to doll. As the minutes passed, you realized that you were beginning to enjoy playing with Lilith and her dolls and stuffed toys. The "tea party" progressed until Lilith announced another game.

Mrs. Parker poked her head in to see how you two were doing, "Hey girls, everything alright?"

"Yes mommy", Lilith replied excitedly, "Jasmine and I are in the middle of our game".

You smiled at Mrs. Parker to show that you are actually enjoying the games and found to your surprise that you actually gave a genuine smile instead of the fake one you intended.

"So, whooooo's hungry?", Mrs. Parker asked cheerily.

"Meeee. meeee. meeeee!", you both chorused, jumping with excitement and clapping little hands.

"Great, I'll be right back with cookies and juice.:", with that Mrs. Parker left.

You both returned to your game, with a little more excitement than was there before. Soon, Mrs. Parker returned with a serving tray containing a plate with a mix of cookies and chips, as well as two classes of orange juice. "Enjoy", she said placing the serving tray on the table on which you were earlier playing "tea party".

As soon as Mrs. Parker left, you both dived into the cookies and juice and ate until you were full. When Mrs. Parker returned to retrieve the serving tray with the plates and glasses, she cooed, "Oooh, Jasmine, look at you, you;re such a mess. I'll have to clean you up..." . With that, she took you into the nearby bathroom, Lilith's you presumed, where she wiped the cookie smudges from your mouth and, dampening a wash rag, attempted to wipe the orange juice stains from the front of your dress. You were surprised to see the spill on your dress as you had not realized that you had made a mess while drinking your juice.

After the bathroom episode, you and Lilith continued playing until you heard the sound of the doorbell, "that must be my mommy", you said with childish excitement, "She's here, she's here", you screamed gleefully as you sprang up and dashed toward the door. Lilith ran behind you, "hey, wait for me...".

It was indeed your mom at the door and she was talking to Mrs. Parker, "How was Jasmine?", she asked.

"Mommiiiieeee!", you screamed with delight as you literally jumped into her arms. Mrs. Storms was taken aback by your enthusiastic greeting and was not sure how to react. Mrs. Parker laughed, "Well, she sure is happy to see you. Both girls had fun today. We should arrange another play date..."

"Yes, please, please, please...", Lilith pleaded, jumping with excitement. You too wanted another play date, and you joined the plea, "Yes mommy, pleeeeaaase...", you pleaded.

"Ooohhh, OK then, it looks like we have ourselves another play date to arrange", your mom said.

"Yes, we certainly do", smiled Mrs. Parker.
111112112112121222221111112212211221111.title: It's disturbingly intuitive.

choices: There has to be another way.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"So what time would work for you?" Mrs. Parker asks.

"Well, er... actually, my schedule is a bit uncertain right now," Mom says. "Would it be alright if I just called you later?"

"Oh, of course," Mrs. Parker says. "Any time should be fine with us."

You furrow your brow. Mom is clearly stalling. You're a little hurt - why would she be reluctant to let you play with Lily again?

...Because you're a teenage boy, that's why.

With a start, you snap out of your childish fugue. Suddenly scared and confused, you clutch your head with one hand and try to collect your thoughts, not listening to Mom and Mrs. Parker finishing their conversation.

"Jasmine," Mom says, regaining your attention, "We have to get going now!" On the surface she sounds cheerful, but now you recognise the worry hidden in her voice. Feeling a severe need to escape this place, you practically run outside.

"Bye, Jasmine!" Lilith calls after you as Mom closes the door.

You and Mom take only a few steps down the path before she stops and lets her concern reach her face. "Jazz, are you... alright?"

"No! I'm not alright!" you reply, a little too loudly. You glance back at the house and hope you weren't heard from inside.

Mom sighs dejectedly. "So you think it's true, then?"

"It was awful," you say, though it certainly didn't feel awful at the time. "First I was just playing along, then I started enjoying it, and then... then I totally forgot myself..."

Mom leads you away from Lilith's house, and once you're out of sight, she turns around and hugs you. "Oh, Jazz..."

"I'm so scared," you whimper, starting to cry into her shoulder. "What if that happens again, except I don't come back from it?"

"Whatever happens," Mom says, "I'll still love you..."

You're tempted to take comfort in the knowledge that if you do become a little girl mentally, you'll at least be a happy one. But that would be giving up. You keep sobbing until Mom lets go of you.

"What are we gonna do?" you ask weakly.

"I think we might just have to trust the doctors..." Mom answers reluctantly.

You groan. Dr. Hanson may have been telling the truth about this, but you still don't want to let him near you - especially since, although you know you can't take the supposed antidote, he still could have been lying about what it does. But what other option do you have?
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Back from the brink

choices: Mom storms out, taking you with her
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Don't let them near me mommy" you said. Mom frowned grimly. "Just five minutes. I want them to to talk to me and this time, they will tell the truth." Thirty minutes later, both you and mom was in Dr. Hanson's office and he was closely examining you. Funally, he stepped back, but mainly to mom's surrpise, there was no look of triumph. Instead, he looked as anxious as mom.

"What's wrong?" you asked.

"Yes, what's wrong, and this time I want the truth. You bastards had lied to us the entire time" mom repeated coldly.

"Please tell me that that serum your detective friend somehow got wasn't used on anyone" Dr Hanson said, almost desparately.

"It wasn't......" mom said.

"Good, because it would it would give full on nightmares to anyone that wittnessed its' effects" Dr Hanson said, cutting mom off from telling him that Ella had used it in a dish.

"What does it do?" you asked. Both the doctor and mom cringed slightly, noticing that your tone had turned slightly more childish.

"Never mind. Mrs Storms. I am telling the truth, the complete truth, that we do not. i repeat, do not have any antidote that will restore your daughter to her original form: Hanson said, much to mom's anger. She began grinding her teeth. "but will do have something that would stop the aparent regression of Jasmine's brain."

"What?" mom demanded coldly. "Why did you not mention this to me?"

"Because you was in no state to listen. You believed that we were the bad guys experiemnting on your daughter, and you would had never accepted this, saying you wanted a real antidote."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: No antidote

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Well then," Dr. Hanson says, "Wait here and I will bring you what you need." He leaves the room.

"Jazz," Mom says, "Do you think you should...?"

"I... I have to," you answer. "I don't wanna lose myself."

After a few very uncomfortable minutes, you hear someone coming. To your surprise, it turns out not to be Dr. Hanson, but Dr. Blake.

"Hello, you two," he says. "I know you haven't gotten along with Dr. Hanson, so I figured you'd rather get this from me. He wasn't happy about it, though."

Mom regards him warily for a second before replying, "Thank you, Dr. Blake."

"So this is gonna fix my brain?" you ask, gazing hopefully at the vial of cloudy liquid in his hand. "Did Lisa get this too?"

"...Lisa Brown? Didn't I advise you against making contact with her?" Dr. Blake respond. A scornful look from Mom prompts him to continue, "No, she did not receive this. I imagine the youth serum has run its course on her brain by now. That's why I was concerned that you'd be frightened if you met her. We weren't sure we'd have this ready in time for you either, but we're quite certain it's safe now."

"How much did she change?" you ask, wondering if it could be more than she realised.

"We don't know. We've sort of made a point of not knowing, actually. Dr. Hanson wanted to study the changes in her behaviour, but we convinced him not to put such stress on the poor girl. He's always been impatient when it comes to furthering our research."

"So what exactly does this chemical of yours do?" Mom asks, taking a confrontational step toward Dr. Blake.

"This formula is designed to halt the ongoing effects of the youth serum," he replies before looking down at you. "You see, although the serum made short work of most of your body, brain cells are affected much more slowly. By neutralising the lingering serum in your brain, this antidote will prevent further mental regression."

You don't like his use of the word 'further'. Mom asks the obvious question: "But... will it reverse the changes that have already happened?"

"That's... difficult to say," Dr. Blake says. "What symptoms have you noticed?"

You bite your lip and avoid listening as Mom tells of your episode with Lilith.

"I see," Dr. Blake says afterwards. He sounds more intrigued than concerned, but quickly switches back to his helpful tone. "I'm afraid I don't know what will happen, then... the brain may or may not reassert its original shape after this treatment. At the very least, however, it sounds as though you should be able to control yourself as long as you avoid indulging in childish things."

You sigh, imagining yourself living a double life where you slip into a little girl's mindset on a regular basis. Ella will have a field day if she finds she can get you to act girly without having to worry about you being stuck that way.

"Well, we shouldn't waste any more time," Dr. Blake says, uncorking the vial and handing it to you. "The serum is still acting on your brain as we speak. You had better swallow the antidote right away."

"I have to drink it?" you ask, feeling very apprehensive.

"Ideally, yes. It will act faster if ingested."

You look at Mom, sharing in the worry shown on her face. You look at Dr. Blake, dearly hoping you can trust him. Finally, you take a deep breath and gulp down the contents of the vial.

"Unh... ow..." you moan, feeling a dull burning in your throat and dropping the empty vial when you start to feel lightheaded.

"Jazz!" Mom exclaims, catching you as you fall over sideways.

"You may feel sleepy," you barely register Dr. Blake saying. "Don't worry. You'll be fine."

You stare at the floor, unable to form thoughts, until you black out.


You wake up in what seems like a hospital bed, finding your body in a strange state of partial paralysis. You don't feel tired at all, but it's difficult to make yourself move. Mom and Ella look down at you from your right, while James and Zoe are on your left.

"Jazz!" Mom says. "Are you okay? They said you were in a coma!"

"I told you it was nothing to worry about, Mrs. Storms," you hear Dr. Hanson say. You slowly turn your head to see him in the doorway of the small room you're in. "A brief cessation of conscious activity was within our expectations."

"Brief?!" Mom incredulously exclaims. "It's been six hours!"

"Well, she's awake now," Dr. Hanson impatiently states. "Now, we should test to see if..."

"Get out," Mom orders him.

Dr. Hanson sighs in frustration. "Very well," he grumbles as he turns to leave.

Feeling the power of movement return to you, you manage to sit up, mumbling incoherently.

"I'm glad you're alright, dude," James says.

"Yeah," Zoe and Ella say in unison. You chuckle weakly at their rare display of unity.

"They scanned your brain, and they said there's no more youth serum in there," Zoe says. "So you'll be fine."

Fine except for being stuck with a little girl's body, you think. But this is no time to complain about that. You look over your family, waiting for someone else to talk, but they all seem to be hesitating, like there's something they don't want to say.

"So, um, Jazz?" Ella finally starts. "Don't be mad at me, but... I thought you might like to see your friend..."

You gasp, thinking you're about to see Lilith, or maybe Nathan. But instead, Ella lifts up her hand and you see she's holding Candy... er, she's holding that doll from Lilith's house.

"So?" Ella says, wiggling the doll in front of your face. "Would you like to play with her?"
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Cutting your losses

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"No thank you. But you're free to play with her" you said in a tired sounding voice. James smirked slightly, while Zoe chuckled at your outburst. Ella shook her head.

"Jazz. I wasn't trying to be insensitive or anything..." Ella said. Zoe at once seized on it.

"Yeah right. Our brother is like this and you're offering her dolls! What's next. Pink bedrooms and dress-up costumes?" Zoe snapped, triggering another twin quarrel. You zoned out, wondering what is going to happen now. You're stuck like this, a five year old girl, and any chance of you continuing your life is gone. Yes, you had no desire to play with Candy.. er Lilith's doll, but what would happen if you're with other girls. You don't know. plus, as the twins had unhelpfully pointed out, since you're stuck you''re going to need a new bedroom, and soon. Having nothing left here, mom motioned for the still arguing twins to head for the car. She left, leaving you and James behind.

"You okay?" James asked.

"Not really. Its starting to sink in what this all means" you said. As you took a step, you noticed that Ella must have dropped Candy. You picked it up.

"Why are you picking that thing up? Y-you don't really want to play with it, and you're hiding it" James asked, concern in his voice. You gave a slightly bitter laugh.

"No. But i was given this. It doesn't feel right leaving it, somehow" you said. After a few seconds, you started smiling mischieviously. "Maybe I should keep it."

"What? Why?" James said.

"Say hello to 'Blackmail Candy', Ella's new bedtime doll" you said.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: An indifferent little girl

choices: ... and sneak off to get her photo
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Sure this is a good idea?" James whispered to you outside Ella's bedroom door.

"Yes! You heard Ella before. Once we got home, she and Zoe started arguing. First about changing my room, then to what theme. Its like she has decided that now that we knows I'm stuck like this for good, she wants to 'help' me move on. Have you got Candy?"

"Don't call it by a name" James said wincing, as he held your new doll.

"Fine. Okay, do you you have the doll that Ella sleeps with?" you asked, surpressing the giggle you wanted to release. He smiled as he tossed it to you as you pushed open Ella's door. As you expected, your girly sister was asleep. James knelt down so you could tell him the last part of your plan.

"Good she is asleep. As soon as I plant the doll next to her and sneak out of range, you take the photo" you said, as you quietly snuck into Ella's room. Your heart in your mouth, you slowly placed Candy by Ella's head...
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: payback prank

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Just as you placed the doll by Ella's head, she moved. You froze, your heart beating fast as you feared she would open her eyes and see you. Ella signed in contentment and snuggled the doll closer to her face. You slowly exhaled as you backed cautiously away from her bed. James crept softly towards Ella's bed and snapped her picture. When Ella did not move, James snapped another picture, "just in case...", he whispered.

You quickly, but silently scampered from the twin's bedroom and ran to the safety of your room. Once inside, you both collapsed with laughter. "Can't wait to hear Ella's reaction when she sees that doll instead of hers", James said between stifled laughs. "Yeah..", you replied, barely containing your own laugh.

You and James talked for a while longer, the bond between you just like old times. You felt good that you and your brother are once again in that familiar "guy zone", although you were, for all appearances, the kid sister.


Ella's piercing scream woke you up with a start, and your eyes opened to the daylight from your bedroom window. James also bolted wide awake by the same scream. You barely made it out of the bed, however, when your room door burst open and an angry Ella stormed in,

"Which one of you did this??", she demanded, holding Candy the doll by one arm.

You and James exchanged innocent glances, "not me...", you said. James echoed the same.

Ella was not amused, "I know it's one of you so fess up, or i'll call mom."

With the same innocent demeanor, you smiled and asked, with a hint of "sisterly" concern, "Ella dear, don't you remember taking Candy to bed with you instead of your usual doll?..."

"Wh-what??", Ella exclaimed, "I couldn't have! I know I didn't take this doll to bed with me. James, where is my doll??"

James looked at Ella, and just as innocently as you did, replied, "Ella, sis, you have been through a lot lately so we'll forgive you for thinking that Jazz and I could have pulled such a prank on you.."

"Mmmooomm!....", Ella whined, and more urgently, ".....mom!"

Zoe slouched in, still bleary eyed having just woken up, "H-hey guys, what's happening?"

"Zoe, did you see James or Jazz enter our room last night?", Ella asked her sister.

"No. I was fast asleep", Zoe replied.

Mom entered the room, concern etched on her face, "What is it? Did something happen to Jazz??", she asked, breathless from running up the stairs.

You piped in, "I'm OK mom. It's just Ella who thinks we did something to cause her to sleep with Lilith's doll Candy..."

"That's not true Mom", Ella said desperately, appealing to Mom, "...the boys did something, I know they did something to switch my doll for this, but they won't admit it!."

You realized that Ella just referred to you and your brother as the "boys", and you smiled to yourself.

"...and what are you smiling about?", Ella asked, at the same time turning to Mom, "see, see, Jazz knows something that's why she's smiling!"

"she's"..., so much for being one of the boys, you thought ruefully. Mom turned to you, and in the tone she uses on you kids to get the truth, intoned, "What do you know about this Jazz?" Normally, mom's tone would have been enough for you to immediately confess to your part in any wrong doing. This time though, you were determined to conceal the truth. "Honestly mom, I don't know what happened with Ella's doll, it must have been transformed into Candy..", you lied.

"I'm disappointed with you Jazz, and as for you James, don't think you are off the hook. I want you both to get Ella's doll back and apologize to your sister. Now get ready for school, you don't want to be late."

With that, Mom left the room to prepare breakfast. You made a face at Ella and stuck out your tongue, "Won't tell you anything", you said, all too childishly, but you hardly noticed.
Ella was still upset but she knew that it was pointless trying to get you or James to fess up. "Wait until I get back from school later, I'll deal with you then..", she promised, with more than a hint of animosity.

It was Zoe who changed the tone of everything, "Yes, we all go back to school today, but what about Jazz, where will she go...?", she asked.

It dawned on you that in all that had taken place over the past few days, you had not thought about how you will return to school. In fact, it appears, no one else did.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: ... and sneak off to get her photo

choices: First day at school, Jazz makes a new friend
First day at school, Jazz faces a bully
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"I hope mom sends you to kindergarten!, Ella sneered as she stomped out of the room, almost colliding into Mom who had returned, phone in hand. "Ella!...", Mom gasped surprised, "..get a hold of yourself!..."

"Sorry mom", Ella muttered, walking with less stomp as before.

Mom turned to you and cheerfully announced ,"I just got off the phone with your principal. She's looking forward to seeing you at school today...".

You could hardly believe your ears. "Mom, I can't possibly go back to school now, not like this. What would my friends and classmates think seeing a 5 year old in school?", you protested.

Zoe appealed, "Yeah Mom, you really should reconsider this. Jazz cannot go back to school until he returns to normal..."

"Yeah..", James agreed.

Mom smiled, "I agree. That's why until she returns to normal, Jazz is going to another school, where she will meet kids her age."

You were mortified. "Are you sending me to k-k-kindergarten?", you sputtered. You suddenly felt queasy and for a moment wished desperately to lie down. Zoe and James stared wide eyed at their mom as though she had suddenly gone insane.

"Please mom, you're not serious, I can't possibly go to kinder. What will I do there? I'll die of boredom", you said, trying your best to sound like a teen but only succeeding in whining like a five year old.

"Jazz, please understand that I cannot leave you home alone while your sisters and brother are at school...", Mom explained.

You were, however, not listening. How could mom do this to you? Your mind reeled as horrible images of you at kindergarten flashed through your mind. Painful memories of your first day at school flooded you and before you realised it, tears welled up in your eyes and your face crumpled. You threw a tantrum.

"Waaaaaaa, I don't wanna go!, I don't wanna go!, Please mommy, I don't wanna go!....", you wailed. Throwing yourself on the ground and kicking your little feet furiously, you continued to scream, "...Don't wanna go to school! Please mommy, let me stay home..."

It took a moment for Mom to regain her composure in the face of your unexpected outburst. "Jasmine...", she said soothingly, "...we cannot spend the whole time arguing this. I simply cannot leave you home alone, I cannot find any baby sitter available today to babysit you..."

"...I don't wanna baby sitter!", you screamed, petulantly.

Mom continued, ignoring your outburst, "...and besides, I would be breaking the law if I allowed you to stay home on a school day when you are not being home schooled..."

"Then take me to work with you...", you wailed.

"Sorry sweetie, I wish I could but you know the nature of my business. My office is no place for little kids like you...", Mom replied.

"Puleeeeaaase...", you begged, "I'll be on my best behaviour you won't even know I'm there."

Mom was loosing her patience with you and had just about enough of your whining protests. Holding you firmly by your shoulders, she shepherded you, kicking and screaming, towards the bathroom, "Come on now Jazz, lets get you dressed for school."



Around forty five minutes later, you were dressed for school. The navy blue dress with the brightly coloured animal patterns made you look everything like a five year old on her first day at school. The small pink and white backpack along with the bright yellow Sponge Bob lunch kit completed the look. You were however scowling and petulant.

Mom tried to make light of your discomfort, "Come on Jazz, you know this is only temporary until you return to normal. Then you can look back at this day and laugh."

She pulled you close and planted a wet kiss on your cheek, which you immediately wiped off. At least the others are not here to see you like this as they had already left on the school bus, you thought in relief. You didn't think you could ever live this down.

"Smile for the camera Jazz!", Mom coaxed.

"Look at my little girl ready for her first day at her new school...", she cooed as she snapped a photo that you were obviously not posing for. Mom then pulled you toward the car, and with you still scowling, strapped you into the child seat.

Moments later, Mom was driving you to your new kindergarten school.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Off to school you go

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Oh, cheer up, Jazz," Mom pleads as you reluctantly exit the car. "This isn't me giving up, okay? I'll try my best not to leave you stuck with this."

Less than encouraged, you let out a long groan of frustration and despair.

"Come on, honey," Mom says, "Just try to enjoy yourself a little, will you? This doesn't have to be all bad... I'll see you later."

With that she gets back in the car and drives off. Once again her departure brings about that sense that you really are just a kid, as if she's taking a part of you with her.

You trudge into the kindergarten grounds and look over the children playing outside. You don't see Lilith anywhere, so that's a small relief. Hopefully she doesn't come here, but she could simply be absent today or even just hiding somewhere.

"Hey, whassa matter?" comes a kid's voice from your left. You wince and grit your teeth before turning to look at this... girl, you think? The stick-thin limbs and just-shy-of-shoulder-length hair suggest as much, but the T-shirt and shorts display no pretense of femininity. You wish you were dressed like that. "Are you lonely? I'll be your friend!" she says. Your dismissive muttering does nothing to discourage her, and she forcefully grabs your hand. "I'm Connie! Who're you?"

"Jasmine," you sigh, reluctant to let your new moniker escape your lips.

"It's nice to meetcha, Jasmine!" Connie beams, shaking your hand so vigorously that you lose your balance for a second. "Wanna come play with us?"

She gestures to two boys short distance behind her throwing a soft ball back and forth between themselves. A pretty pointless activity, but there are worse things you could be roped into, and you should probably take the opportunity to establish yourself as a tomboy. "Sure, why not," you say.

"Yeah!" Connie cheers. She swiftly drags you closer to the boys; again, you almost fall over. You can hardly believe this scrawny kid can throw you around like this. "Jasmine's gonna play with us!" she announces.

The boy currently holding the ball frowns at you. "She can't play. She's a girl!"

"I'm a girl, stupid!" Connie retorts, conveniently erasing your remaining doubt.

"Yeah, but... she's a girl-girl!" the boy says.

"I am not!" you object. Somewhere in the back of your mind, you dimly recognise how childish you just sounded.

"See? Come on, she's playing!" Connie says. "Jasmine, this is Justin," she points at the boy with the ball, then at the other one, "And Davey!" She then walks into position and holds out her arms. "Pass it!"

You spend a short while participating in the aimless game of catch. The rhythm of it (as much as a bunch of kindergartners can achieve rhythm) is sort of relaxing, and it certainly beats some of the things you've been made to do recently. Still, being an equal to these kids doesn't sit well with you. Feeling a need to assert your superiority, you decide to mess with them a little.

The next time you catch the ball, you hold it up and swing it in a fake throw toward Justin. He stumbles comically, and Connie bursts out laughing at him. While she's distracted, you lightly toss the ball at her. She produces a little "Oof!" as it bounces off her, then stares blankly at you for a moment, making you wonder if that was a bit much. But then she laughs again. "I like you! You're funny!"

You can't help but chuckle and grin, if only briefly. Everything aside, there's no denying the charm of a smiling little girl... as long as it's not you, at least.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: First day at school, Jazz makes a new friend

choices: You later got into trouble with one of the kids
You were called up to read, how will you do?
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
All too soon the bell rang signaling the start of classes. You and your new friends ran toward the classroom and noisily settled down in the seats. It took a while for your teacher, Miss Summers, to get you all settled. "Be quiet children!", she said, as you slid into your seat and adjusted your bag by your feet.

You were now a little more settled and Miss Summers began the roll call. You hardly paid attention as you looked around and noticed Lilith sitting to the right of the room. You had not seen her earlier during play and you were actually relieved to see her. At least I have some friends here after all, you thought.

"Jasmine Storms"

You did not answer, as you had not been paying attention.

"Jasmine Storms!:, Miss Summers said again, a little louder.

"Oh.....I'm here!", you responded. The other children laughed. Miss Summers was not amused.

"Oh I see we have a smart one here, have we?", she said, looking at you closely. "I know you are new here so you are not fully aware of how to behave yet.", Miss Summers continued.

You were puzzled. What the hell is she talking about? What have I done wrong now? you thought.

"Jasmine, when we do roll call, the correct way to answer is "present Miss Summers", or "Here Miss Summers", is that clear?"

You nodded, and catching yourself, responded, a little reluctantly "Yes Miss Summers".

Miss Summers continued the roll call to the last name, "Jonathan Zlot", to which a big kid with shaggy red hair answered.

"OK class, we will be doing some phonics so get your books out for this exercise", Miss Summers announced, "We are looking at vowels and will start with the Aa sound."
The rustle of books on desks as the children eagerly pulled out their phonics books contrasted with your slow and reluctant effort to take your book out. This is definitely going to be one boring day after all, you thought ruefully.

But, it was not long before you were proved wrong.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Class begins.

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Finally" you muttered to yourself as the phonics lesson ended and your first break began. Apart from the mind numbing boredom, that big kid, Jonathan Zlot, was next to you and didn't take your under the breath comment that this was easy too kindly. As you saw the kids begin to pick out things to play with, you was disappointed to see that all the balls were taken. you looked up and saw that connie had the last ball. You was about to go to her, since she looked up and saw her, when Lilith came over . She had some dolls and urged you to follow her.

Great. Like like home you thought to yourself. You didn't want to choose. While you had no desire to really play with dolls, you did appriciate a friendly face, and didn't want to lose it. Nor did you want to lose a friend who could make up feel almost normal. As you waited, a voice hissed, "Princeth smarth mouth."

"Go away Johnathon" you said to the boy who was much larger than you. As you said it, both Connie and Lilith turned back and saw you was in trouble.

"What did you say. 'i learnth thith...' Fine. Burb the abc's"

"Ewww. That's gross" Connie said. You wasn't paying too much attention, but Jonathon grabbed you by your hair and hissed for you to do what he says. You was determiined not to give in, but when he pulled even harder, you started to cry, just like when you was hit in the face with the basketball.

"Jonathon Zloty. You don't pull a girl's hair. go to the time out corner" miss Summers yelled, as she saw and heard your sobs. He released you, and walked off. Both lilith and Coonie went up to you at once, while all the other girls were grouped nearby.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: You later got into trouble with one of the kids

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
With a sniffle, you wipe the tears from your eyes. Ridiculous; who cries just from having their hair pulled? You know the answer, of course, and it only makes you feel worse.

"Are you alright, Jasmine?" Miss Summers asks in a tone you suppose a five-year-old would find soothing.

"I'm fine," you respond in a futile effort to seem unfazed.

"Don't let him get to you," she says. "If he makes trouble again, just shout, okay?"

"Okay," you mumble, but you have no intention of shouting on teacher for anything. If Jonathan comes after you again, you'll be ready for him... or so you like to believe, at least.

Miss Summers walks away while you just stand there looking morose, though not quite for the reasons the children around you would believe.

"He's just jealous!" Connie barks. "It's good that you're smart!"

"I know," you sigh. Were you anyone else around here, she probably would have succeeded in making you feel better.

A few uneasy seconds go by until suddenly, Connie is her upbeat self again. "Okay, c'mon! Let's go play!"

Oh boy. You turn to Lilith in anticipation of her vaguely offended reaction: "Nuh-uh! We gotta play house!"

Dammit. This should be an easy choice, but as you look into Lily's expectant eyes, the thought of turning her down becomes difficult to bear. The part of your brain urging you to get away from her is countered by the part that feels a strange bond with her, perhaps because your subconscious can't quite register your trip to her house as anything other than a good time.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: A strange dilemma

choices: You get way too into it and start thinking like a little girl again
You find yourself getting ridiculously bored.  What's Connie up to?
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content: No matter how hard you try, you can't help but feel sorry for Lilith. "Okay, Lily. We'll play house. Wanna play next time?" Connie doesn't look offended at all and cheerfully says "Sure!" You're a little nervous about playing house with her, considering what happened last time you played with her, but you can't say no to the poor girl. You go over to where Lilith is waiting, who then says "You be the mommy and I'll be the daughter!" As you start to play...
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Go with Lilith.

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Hey! Jasmine!" Connie calls from behind you, sounding farther away than she was before. You turn around just in time for the ball she had to fly into your chest, and she laughs as you instinctively fumble to try and catch it, eventually managing to get a hold of it before it falls to the ground.

"Hey! Don't do that!" an affronted Lilith objects.

Not sharing her complaint, you grin mischievously and fake a low throw before tossing the ball over Connie's head. After a belated little hop to try and catch it, she runs to retrieve the ball, and upon doing so immediately spins around and throws it back, making you jump to the side to intercept it.

Soon the two of you are running around, having left Lily in the dust, making all sorts of attempts to outwit each other with your throws - with you having the most successes, of course, since she's learning all the tricks from you. Part of you objects to how much fun you're having, but it's certainly better to enjoy this than playing tea party.

Once again the school bell is ringing before you know it. If only the lessons could feel so short. Inevitably, on your way back to class you encounter a hurt-looking Lilith, ready to give you the guilt trip of the year.

"Jasmine... I thought we were friends!" she whines.

"We are!" you instantly respond. You don't even know anymore if it's the truth or not. "But... Connie's my friend too. We can play later, okay?"

"Promise?" she pleads, puppy dog eyes and all.

"Yeah. I promise," you say. You're probably going to regret this at some point, but what else could you do? It's too late to just get rid of her.

"Okay..." Lily hangs her head, still looking upset, but with not much more either of you can say, you walk off and take your seat. As you wait for the next round of drudgery to begin, you have a little time to contemplate the absurdity of your situation. Are you seriously going around trying to manage your relationships with other kindergarten pupils? How did it come to this?

The rest of the day is about as unremarkable as it can be. You consider playing dumb on a couple of occasions just to get Jonathan off your back, but you'd hate yourself for doing that. Regardless, he doesn't really bother you again outside of the odd muttered remark. Lilith, meanwhile, hangs around you whenever she can, but Connie proves able to snatch your attention away from her at any time.

When the school day finally comes to a close, you rush outside almost as eagerly as any other child. Lily's mom is already out there waiting, and Lily runs ahead of you to meet her. You hang back, not wanting Mrs. Parker to see you, and thankfully Lily doesn't seem to point you out before the two of them are gone.

"Hey!" Connie startles you by coming up behind you and putting her arms over your shoulders in a flagrant violation of your personal space. "Are you waiting for your mom?"

"Yes," you flatly answer, no longer in any mood to indulge her now that you're almost out of here.

"Is that her?" Connie asks, pointing at some random woman entering the grounds.

"No," you reply, unimpressed.

Connie promptly points at some other woman. "Is that her?"

"No."

"Ummm... is that her?"

To your surprise, she guessed right this time. Mom comes through the gate having parked the car somewhere you didn't see. "Yes," you smile.

"Yeah!" Connie cheers. "And there's my mom!"

Connie runs off to greet her mother, who is standing... right next to yours. Uh-oh. You walk towards Mom, who starts to say something, but stops when Connie gestures to you and says to her mom, "Mom, this is Jasmine!"

"Oh, I see. Hello there!" Connie's mom says before turning to your mom. "I haven't seen you around; are you new here?"

"Um, yes," Mom says. "It seems we have a pair of little friends here, do we?"

"Oh, yes. You know, I'm glad to see Connie get along with another girl for a change, she'll need female friends when she's older..."

To your dismay, they just keep on talking. Connie just smiles up at her mom, seemingly admiring the adult conversation, but you stop paying attention in favour of expressing impatience. After a minute or so of grumpy foot-tapping and a couple of failed attempts to get Mom's attention, you start pushing against her leg to try and make her move, only to stop when you realise how silly (and doubtlessly adorable) you're being.

That relatively minor embarrassment seems to pay off, though - your mom soon says goodbye to Connie's and takes your hand to lead you to the car. Connie waves at you as she skips off in the other direction. "Bye, Jasmine!"

"Well, it doesn't sound like you had such a bad time," Mom says with a smile you really don't want to see.

"Shut up," you groan.

"Don't be like that," Mom says as you get in the car. "Having some good friends will help you deal with this..."

"Mom, come on!" you exclaim. "You said you'd keep trying to fix me..."

"I know, dear," Mom sighs. "But I..."

She trails off, but you think you know why she doesn't want to finish that thought. She doesn't really think anymore that there's any way back to normalcy for you, but she's trying to act otherwise because she thinks you'll complain less if you still have hope that this is temporary. You don't feel like pressing the issue, though. What would be the point?

When you get home, your siblings inquire about your day with varying levels of interest, but you brush them off. You don't want your life at home to be tainted by the things you're being made to take part in.

Unfortunately, it soon is. After about an hour of playing video games and generally lounging around while refusing to answer anyone's questions, you hear the front door open and exit your room in time to hear part of a conversation in progress.

"Just some time with the husband," a woman says. You can't see her - Mom's in the way - but her voice sounds familiar. Is that Lily's mom, or Connie's? They must sound pretty similar, because you can't tell. "I could get a babysitter," whoever-she-is continues, "But she was eager to come and see Jasmine anyway... it's not any trouble, is it?"

"Oh, of course not," Mom says. Great, thanks, Mom. This is the worst day she's given you since you broke that vase when you were seven... you take a moment to wrap your head around the idea that you're younger now than you were then.

Once Mom steps away from the door, you can finally see who's come to visit you...
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Go with Connie

choices: Zoe has some girl video games
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You saw that Lilith was standing in the doorway, looking pleased to see you. "Jasmine" she yelled out, enough for both the twins and James to know that you've got a guest. While you're pleased for a friendly face, you're not at all pleased about all the girliness Lilith would bring to you, or worse, the ideas she might plant into Ella's head.

"Good to see you, Lily" you said, partly meaning it.

"Now we can play. i ran to mommy to see if we can when school ended" Lilith blurted out. "What do your wanna play?"

You internally winced, since her presence brought up some serious problems for you. Firstly your room is still you room, much to your delight, and not at all suitable for a five year old girl; even a tomboy one. No-one, not even Ella has suggested or acted upon changing it, but that could change fast. Plus you don't have any of the things Lilith would call fun. No dress-up clothes. No stuffed animals and definately no dolls. You wondered how to answer...
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: It's Lilith.

choices: later on when lilith has left
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"I can get your things, sis" Ella said cherrfully. Before you could respond, she leapt up and headed upstairs. You risked a glance towards Zoe and James. James was shaking his head, while Zoe was rolling her eyes, and muttering something like 'Course she would'. You wasn't sure, but you know your sisters too well. When mom returned, lilith looked at here and asked, "Mrs Storms? Why can't we go and play in Jasmine's room?"

Mom thought quickly. "Because Jazz is getting her room ren- made better and its to much of a mess for her to be in." You gave a slight smile, but it hid your fears that mom or someone would go and renovate your room. mom lead you to an empty room, which unknown to you, had a matress already laid down. the room was pretty bare, which the exception of a few coloring books and crayons. It gave the impression that you was a visiting relative, but with lilith, it gave the impression that you room was getting changed.

"You okay not having your stuff?" Lilith asked. You nodded, but was interupted by James showing his displeasure towards Ella. She must had returned from her room, and from his reaction, she must had brought something girlish. It wasn't too surprising that two minutes later she returned with a couple of her old dolls, and more disturbingly, a couple of dress up costumes that looked new.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Ella comes to the 'rescue'

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Which do you want to have, Jasmine?" Lilith asked as she picked up a fairy costume, and a princess costume. You winced slightly, at the pinkness of both. Lilith caught it, and looked at you. "Don't you want to play with me?"

"Yes I do. Its just... my sisters are arguing all the time..." you said.

"Huh?" Lilith said surprised. "What do you mean?"

"You've seen my sisters. They both want me to be exactly like them" you said.

"What do you want to do?" Lilith asked. it was the first time anyone asked you that since your transformation and you did appreciate the irony that it came from a five year old girl.

"I would prefer to be like Zoe' you said.

"But why? Ella's pretty" Lilith said.

"She is.."

Lilith looked confused, even though she made up her mind to dress up as a princess. "Don't you wanna look pretty?"

"I just want to look after myself" And regain my independence. "Zoe would had been able to defend herself against that jerk, Jonathon."

"He is a stupid poop head" Lilith said. Despite yourself, you giggled slightly.

'Not all boys are like that" you said. "Connie is with some nice boys."

"So that's why you was with her?"

"Yep' you giggled. By this time, Lilith had finished dressing herself in the costume, and looked expectantly at you to put on the fairy costume. You shrugged your shoulders. While you didn't really think you'd lose yourself like last time your played with her, you was afraid of either Ella or James seeing you dressed up. What the hell? you thought to yourself, as you started to change. you could always say that you wanted to make Ella disappear...

After a while, you stuck your head through to the other room, where Zoe and James had set themselves up playing video games. Ella wasn't with them, which wasn't too surprising. "Where's Ella?"

"She went upstairs about an hour ago and looked like she was on a mission" James said. You panicked, and despite being dressed as a fairy, you leapt into full view as you tried to scramble upstairs.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: playing with Lilith

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Panicked by what James and Zoe said, you ran upstairs, and though you was expecting it, you still alarmed to see Ella sitting on something in your room. So alarmed, you was only focusing on her. "What are you doing in here?" you hissed.

"I'm sorry Jasmine, but it has to be done. I'd admit, mom did surprise me with her little camp out gear downstairs, but that can't last forever" Ella said seriously, none of her usual cheery tone in her voice.

"Done what? What have you done?" you said, bordering on a scream. You took your eyes off Ella and realized that all your posters had been removed from the walls. "You're renovating my room!?" Your panic deepening, you turned, and realized it wasn't just your posters. A single brush-stroke of pastel pink paint was on your wall where it wouldn't be immediately seen. the sight of it send you madder than you've ever been. "Pink?!", the only word you managed to spit out in your rage induced state.

"Jazz. Think about this rationally. You're friends with that Lilith girl. you're now five years old yourself, and that is not going to change. You don't want reminders of what happened to you all the time" Ella said diplomatically.

"But..." you said, anger induced tears running down your face.

"Trust me on this sis. You'd be distressed, even if James decided to change this place to, I don't know, cream, or yellow or something" Ella said as she stood up, revealing she was sitting on the paint tin. While certainly emotional, you had enough rational thought to know if she had no paint, she couldn't finish defiling your room. Quickly you grabbed the paint can, praying that Ella had securely placed the lid on the thing. She did..

"Hey. Give that back, Jasmine" Ella said.

"No way. Lily and I are doing painting" you said, hoping that you'd use it all up. before Ella could react, you rushed back downstairs, and past your surprised brother and sister. Mom was also in the room, thanks to James.

'What have you got there" mom asked.

"Pink paint from Ella" you said, causing James and Zoe to share a glance at each other. Not again mom thought as they rushed upstairs to confront her. Sighing, mom walked after them.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Ella was in your room

choices: Tomorrow afternoon, you're dropped off at Connie's house.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Hey, Lily, look what I found!" you announce as you re-enter the room with the paint can... which is starting to feel really heavy, so you drop it on the floor.

"What's that?" Okay, not a question you were expecting, but she is five.

"It's paint!" you answer.

"Oh! What'll we paint?" Lily asks, fiddling with the can's lid and eventually managing to remove it. "Where's brushes?"

"Oh, uh..." In your impulsive course of action, you hadn't considered that. "I think there's some stuff in the garage?"

"Garage? Are we s'posed to go there?" Lily doubtfully inquires.

"Bit late to think about what we're supposed to be doing," you mutter.

"What?"

"Just follow me," you say. You lift the paint can up on your shoulder - neglecting to reattach the lid, which is still in Lily's hands - and make for the door to the garage. Almost as soon as you get inside, you trip over, grazing your elbow and spilling a large puddle of paint over the floor.

Well. Not the smartest thing you've ever done, but... mission accomplished, you suppose. Mom's not gonna be happy, of course, but at least you missed the car.

"Uh-oh!" Lilith yelps. "Are you alright?"

"I-I'm fine," you stutter, holding back the tears summoned by the pain in your arm.

"Are you gonna get in trouble?"

"Um, I... don't worry about it. You stay here, I'll talk to Mom."

Lily gives no response in the instant she has before you rush off to find your family at the top of the stairs. You sort of expected it to be World War III up here, but as you approach you find to your surprise that the argument seems to be coming to a peaceful conclusion. You see Zoe put her arm on Ella's shoulder in an uncharacteristically friendly gesture.

"It's fair to say that Jazz won't make all the right decisions herself." Oof. Clearly she hasn't noticed you. Ella, however, shoots you a glance before Zoe continues, "But that doesn't mean you can just put yourself in charge. You at least have to go through Mom before you go doing things like that!"

"I know you just want to help, dear," Mom adds. "Bur we all do. We need to work together and get through this as a family."

Mom looks at you thoughtfully, causing Zoe to jump a little when she finally realises you're there. "Jasmine," Mom says, "You trust us, don't you?"

"All of you together? Sure, I guess." Your answer would, of course, be more confident if Ella wasn't included in the question.

"Then here's what we'll do. The four of us will work together to renovate your room. We'll properly discuss everything, we'll do all we can to work out what's best for you, and..." Mom directs a pointed look at the twins before finishing, "There will be no shouting matches."

"But why can't I..." you begin.

"I know it's hard for you," Mom cuts you off, "But if it were up to you, you wouldn't change a thing, would you? Sometimes... it's better to let others make decisions for you."

Maybe she's right, you think as you slouch in defeat. Maybe you're not capable of being rational about this. James and Zoe silently urge you to accept... well, at least with them involved, it shouldn't turn out totally unbearable. With a heavy heart, you nod slowly.

"Thank you," Mom says. "Now then... tomorrow after school we'll leave you with Lilith..."

"Connie," you interject. Your time with Lily today hasn't been the worst thing in the world, but you certainly don't want to make a habit of hanging out with her every day. Your siblings exchange questioning looks while Mom, after a moment's thought, nods in agreement.

"Alright. We'll leave you with Connie, if we can, and we'll get started on shopping for new things for your room."

"But..." you start. But what? You don't want your old things to go, you don't want to leave your decor at anyone's mercy... but you already agreed it was for the best. "Okay," you sigh.

"Good. Now then..." Mom stops when she sees Lily approaching.

"Uh, Jasmine? What's going on?" Lily asks.

"Uh, I dunno," you lie. "Grown-up stuff."

Lily looks at you blankly for a second before turning her attention to Mom. "Uh, Mrs. Storms?" She hangs her head and puts her arms behind her back. "We spilled paint in the garage..."

You shrug and smile nervously in response to Mom's withering stare. Without a word, she lets out her familiar can't-catch-a-break sigh and heads for the garage, Lilith in tow.

"Face, it, sis, it's not gonna be pink walls," James snickers at Ella. "So who's Connie?" he asks you.

Not wanting to share details, you answer, "Let me put it this way. Ella wouldn't like her."

"Ooh! When can I meet her?" Zoe asks. She and James burst into laughter, prompting Ella to march off to her room, grumbling to herself.


Two or three hours later, once Lilith has left, you hesitantly enter the garage to find Mom cleaning the paint off the floor. You've been expecting her to give you hell ever since she saw the spill, but she never said much and still doesn't look angry.

"You know, this brings back memories," she comments wistfully. "I don't know how I ever handled having four little rascals of my own..."

You cringe at the thought that you're reminding Mom of raising actual kids. "Don't say things like that," you plead.

Mom arches an eyebrow. "Well, would you rather I grounded you?"

"Ground me?" The concept strikes you as meaningless. "I might as well be grounded already. It's not like I can go anywhere."

"Well, if you were grounded, we couldn't take you to see Connie," Mom nonchalantly remarks as she continues cleaning. "You like her, don't you?"

"Okay, go ahead and ground me, and then Ella can stay here to watch me instead of going shopping with you," you say.

Mom shakes her head. "I never did think grounding was a good punishment."

You chuckle. Subject matter aside, this is actually a nice, casual conversation you're having for once. But you doubt you'll like where it'll go if you keep it up, so you head upstairs.

You look around your mostly untouched, comfortingly familiar room and sigh before looking down at yourself. You can't deny it's a total mismatch. You climb onto your bed and take a few pictures of the place with your phone. Soon afterward, you decide you might as well get some sleep.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: The prevention of pink painting

choices: You complained to Mom, you don't want to return
You changed your mind and said nothing to mom, you'll deal with Miss Summers
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
The teacher, Miss Summers, was going through numerals and basic maths, and you were, as usual, not paying attention. What the hell for, anyway, you thought. After all, this is kid stuff and you had done this before. Instead, your mind was on the impending changes to your room which, you really did not want. You felt almost powerless to stop what is happening around you and this is becoming a little maddening.

"JASMINE STORMS!", followed by a loud rap on the teacher's desk.

You literally jumped out of your seat in fright at this unwelcomed interruption to your thoughts.

"H-H-Huh?", you stuttered before realising that all eyes were on you and Miss Summers was glaring angrily.

"Ohh....., yes Miss Summers?", you asked, a little timidly. You did not know what kind of trouble you are in this time.

"I asked you a question young miss", Miss Summers said tersely, a few snickers followed her remark. "I am waiting on your answer."

You did not know what to say, since you actually did not hear the question. You wondered if it was a good idea to ask her to repeat it since as you could clearly see, Miss Summers was not in the least amused.

"Ummm, Uhmmm, I don't know?", you managed.

"Very well then. You will have to do that for your homework and return tomorrow with the answer.", she said before continuing with the lesson. You were bewildered. Of course, you just answered a question you did not hear, and being incorrect, you now have it to do for homework, still clueless about what this entailed.

"Oh Great shit to be caught in. Just my luck.", you thought.

"What did you say???" Miss Summers thundered. The class fell silent.

"N-n-nothing", you quickly said, realising at that moment that what you thought you were thinking was actually said out loud and Miss Summers heard. You braced yourself for what might happen next.

The painful grip on your upper arm caused you to yelp involuntarily, eliciting laughter from the rest of the class. Miss Summers was pulling you and muttering angrily, "Off to the Principal's office with you young lady. I have just about enough of your inattentiveness and impertinence!." Your little feet could hardly keep up with the angry strides of your kindergarten teacher and the pain in your upper arm seemed to grow more intense with every step. Tears sprung to your eyes and you protested weakly, "P-please, you're hurting me..."

_________________________

In the Principal's office, you sat miserably as Miss Summers related what had just transpired, adding some generous embellishments as she did. You squirmed as you realised that what Miss Summers was doing was building a bad case against you so that the Principal will have to dish out the harshest punishment. You wanted to blurt out that she was telling a load of crap but you remembered who and where you were and kept quiet. Shit, this is not good, you thought. I might as well be hit by a bus and be done with it, you thought miserably.

When Miss Summers was through telling her lies, you were simmering with rage and had to bite your lips hard not to say anything.

"Well Miss Storms", the Principal, Mrs. Forrest said, looking at you deeply. "What have you got to say for yourself?", she asked.

"I know all this stuff already and the class is boring!", you blurted without thinking.

Both adults were taken aback. You realised too late that you have blurted a secret that you might have to explain.

"Uhmm, I mean, my mom taught me all that stuff already so it's not new to me. And I'm bored...", you said.

"Then, why did you answer the question I asked with an "I don't know", huh?", Miss Summers asked. The Principal gave the teacher a "Let-me-handle-this" look before turning to you.

"So, your mom taught you everything. That does not give you the license to do anything less than pay attention in class, is that clear?", she asked.

You nodded, and realising that this is not the best thing for a five-year old to do, mumbled, "Yes Mrs Forrest."

"I will not put this on your record this time Jasmine, but you will have to learn to control yourself and your utterances. Remember, we are an institution of bright little minds that need to be shaped with only good things. We do not want any disruptive forces here.", she said, a little too coyly for your liking.

You muttered a barely audible, "Yes Miss", before being ushered out by Miss Summers, back to class. On your way back, Miss Summers stopped, spun you around and stooping so that you were both at eye level, hissed "Now let me tell you this missy, I don't know what your game is but I will not have you mess with my class. I have my eye on you, so from now on, you keep your butt out of my hair and we will be really good friends...". The last bit ending as though she was reciting a poem.

You froze, not knowing how to react. You really did not expect this venom from your class teacher and was a little terrified about what might happen if you dared to say anything smart. You only managed a small squeak, "Y-yes Miss Summers..." before the two of you continued walking towards the classroom as though the little exchange did not happen.

You resolved in your mind never to return to this kindergarten no matter how much pressure mom might put on you.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: The next day, at kindergarten...

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Bye Jasmine" Lilith said cheerfully as her mom arrived to take her home. You waved goodbye with a paint smeared hand and headed inside. James was waiting for you.

"Nice outfit sis" he said, a slight smirk on his face.

"Hmmpp" you snorted. "Least I stopped Ella's scheme. I'm going to bed." While you don't really want to admit it, your younger body does get tired easier, especially when you're dealing with five year olds."

James looked hesitant. "About that.... mom wants to talk to all of us."

"About time! I'm sick of Ella forcing me into being her private doll! Guess she replaced the one we stole with me" you said ruefully. James smiled thinly, remembering how he and you stole her doll with the intent of getting her to back off. Pity it seemed to result in the opposite response.

"Sorry I hadn't been too much of a help stopping you from ending up in skirts. I was just too stunned for me to respond" he said. You gave a sigh and looked at him.

"Tell me about it. You see why I was freaked out at the mall?"

"I see" James said. 'What are you going to do about it, Jazz? Nathan rang while you was painting, and the whole you've got flu going to work forever. He's suspicious, especially since he knows something was spilt onto you."

"I don't know. I'll think of something" you said tiredly. "Where is mom having this big talk of hers?"

"Your room, but..." James started, but you was off before he could finish. You bounded up the stairs, opened your room and gasped, as you saw that your walls had been fully painted pastel pink. Mom, Zoe and an awkward looking Ella was sitting on your bed, which thankfully, looked the same as always. Other than your walls, your room looked more or less intact.

"What happened to my room?!" you yelled, realizing Ella must had a second tin of paint. And that mom had allowed this to happen.

"Ella Storms..." mom said sternly.

"I'm to finish off the renovations" Ella said in a voice far from triumphant.

"And..." mom said.

"Then I'm to stop" Ella reluctantly said.

"What does that mean?" you growled.

"it means I will not have us tearing each other apart" mom said.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: hours later

choices: confess that you're a kid again
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You're pleased and annoyed with the rest of your family. Annoyed because everyone, even James, was in on the fact Ella had redesigned your room into little girl heaven and did nothing to stop her. instead, all you got was the whole lecture on 'keeping up appearances', not that would do you any good. A part of you wondered how James or Zoe would like their rooms girlified. The pleasing part was that mom made it clear your room was the final thing that would be changed and Ella would not force you into anything more girly like ballet or whatever torturous thing she could think of.

"Morning Jazz. Still little miss grumpy?" James teased as you walked down for your breakfast.

"I'm fine" you said with a wary look towards Ella.

"Sure? You seemed to had enjoyed sticking your tongue out at Ella" James said, slightly more seriously. You wanted to roll your eyes, since he seemed to be acting like the protective big brother. in this cause, he was worried you was acting like a little brat.

"The Allies won WW2, if a+67/3=12, a is -31, and if you put a match to hydrogen gas, it would produce an exothermic reaction with atmospheric oxygen to produce water. Happy now?" you said, almost crossly. James stared at you. "Huh?"

"It means your little sister is smarter than you, James" Zoe said, a slight smirk on her face. She paused knowing it was a bad time, but she said it anyway. "Jasmine, you need to get ready for kindergarten."

"Arrrgh. I've already proven I'm smarter than that! Why do I have to go there?" you whined.

"Sorry Jazz, but you have to" mom said, her face sympathetic. As you slouched towards the stairs, you heard the phone ring. Without thinking, you picked it up. "Hello. Jazz...." you began to say, but you stopped yourself. It could be anyone on the other end...

"Jazz! You okay?" Nathan asked over the phone. "You sound like a kid..."

Not good. He knew that you got the youth serum spilled onto you.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: next morning

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"...Jasper, I don't care if you or your family says that you're sick, I'm coming to see you right now" Nathan said firmly.

Definitely not good. Gulping, you realized that you're out of time, and Nathan will discover your fate within the next thirty minutes. "Nathan...." you said, in your childish voice.

"I knew it. Chelsea said I was crazy" Nathan said. "So how old are you man, and when does it wear off?"

"I'm five" you snapped suddenly, the tension of the past week finally catching up to you. "Nathan chuckled to himself and after you told him its not funny, he turned serious. "I should had known you must be little, considering how high that voice is. It must had been a shock to you finding that you was a five year old boy again."

I wish you thought glumly, even though you're glad that he hadn't freaked out and hung up on you. Then again, he would be the easiest person to tell, since he knew everything that you knew from the field trip. "Nathan, they told me that its irreversible. They can't age me back up."

Nathan paused for a few seconds, like it he was caught off guard. "What did you say? That you're stuck as a 5 year old boy?" All his previous amusement faded to horror. "Oh man. I'm sorry. I'll tell Chelsea if you want. It'll sound crazy, but I'll find a way.... You're sure you're stuck?"

"They're already put me in (wince) kindergarten and redecorated my room."

"I.. I have to go" Nathan said, waiting a few seconds before hanging up. You held the dead phone and turned to mom. She shook her head.

"You took a big risk, Jasmine, answering that phone. But do you feel better?"

"Not really" you said in a small voice. "He thinks all that serum did was knock me back a decade. Mom, do I really have to go to kindergarten? I'm so bored, and I could be a disruption. Its not fair on me or the other kids" you pleaded, hoping a more rational reasoning would sway mom.

"I'm sorry Jazz, but yes. Go get dressed for kindergarten... and don't deliberately try and get yourself into trouble" mom said, slightly worried that you might actually try to prove your point.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: confessions that lead to a wrong conclusion

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Reluctantly you trudged to the classroom of your kindergarten after being dropped off by mom. You were still thinking about what happened yesterday with Nathan and how he found out that you were five again. At least, he did not see that you were actually a girl, yet, you thought. You had hoped that mom would have seen it your way and kept you home, but that was not to be, as despite all your complaining and whining this morning, mom got you dressed and here you were again, at kindergarten.

"Hi Jasmine", Lilieth waved and skipped over to you.
"Oh, hi Lilly.", you replied, not too enthusiastically.
"Let's play together later", she said, not noticing your less than encouraging mood.
"Oh, alright", you said.
Connie came over with another girl who you barely remembered.
"Jasmine, want to play with us later?", she greeted. "Oh, hi Lilly."
"I asked her first!", Lilly interrupted before you could answer.
"Yeah, Lilly asked me first", you said.
"Why can't you play with us instead Jasmine?", Connie asked, her friend, whose name you did not know, joined in "Yes, please we can play together..."
You were not really in a mood to be in the middle of a tug-of-war between your two friends wanting to play. You replied "Maybe we could all play together, you know with Lilly..."
Lilieth however was not happy with that suggestion, although you thought it was a good compromise.
"No! I don't want to play with Connie! I want to play with you!", she yelled.
Just before anyone said anything further, your teacher, Miss Summers entered the classroom.

"OK children, lets settle down now for today's lessons", she said.

You were relieved as you took your seat and the others went to theirs.

The rest of the day was uneventful and you were only too eager to meet mom when she returned to pick you up.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: another day at kindergarten

choices: Mom decides to accept the payment
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You sighed as mom drove into the driveway, and stopped the car. Between your two new squabbling friends, Nathan (and assumingly, Chelsea) knowing you're a kid again, but of course, believing you're still a boy, and your two squabbling sisters, you just wanted to get away. even lying in the pink, girlified monstrosity that is now your room sounded pretty good. You wanted to go straight inside, but mom was by the mail box. it seemed there was something inside.

"What is it mommy" you asked, wincing slightly. you wanted to use 'mom' and not sound so childish, but it seemed to become harder with every passing day.

"iIs from the genetics lab" mom hissed. She opened the letter, and you could tell it contained something, judging from the look of shock and anger displayed on mom's face.

"its saying I'm going to start becoming more girl-like?" you inquired, airing your worst fears. You shuddered at the memory of the time you was playing with Lilith and went completely girly and childish.

"No sweetie" mom said, leaning against the car, as if she was trying to steady herself. "They're trying to buy our silence. They're offering us two million dollars as a settlement."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: At home, a major decision

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You could hardly believe what mom just said, and you asked her whether she was serious. Mom did not reply as she was still looking at the letter from the Genetics Lab with rising consternation. She pulled other mail from the mailbox and, with you in tow, strode inside the house. Zoe was sitting on a couch reading, the others were nowhere in sight.

"Oh, hi mom, ..Jazz", Zoe said placing the book beside her. Mom tossed the mail on the entrance table and headed to the kitchen, barely acknowledging Zoe's greeting. You followed mom.

"Hey, guys, what's the matter?", Zoe asked as she too followed you to the kitchen.

You quipped, "Mom's just got an offer in the mail..."

"Whoa, ...really? Who's it from?", Zoe asked eagerly.

"Oh, only those pricks from the lab who think they can buy me off", mom replied with a smile that belied the anger she was actually feeling. Zoe was surprised.

"Mom, you can't be serious! How much are they offering?", Zoe exclaimed.

"Surely, you really don't expect me to tell you how much, do you? I really don't care if it's ten million these bastards cannot hope to buy my silence about what has happened to your brother with a measly two mill..." she stopped and poured herself a drink, tossing two ice cubes into the glass. You realized suddenly that you had never seen your mom drink alcohol before and you were getting worried.

"Mom....You sure you should be drinking that now...?", you asked.

"Oh, never mind this Jazz. It's just my way of getting the edge off. It has been one hell of a day and I need to calm down before I do something about this latest insult. The nerve of those rotten bastards!"

You were startled and looked at Zoe, who was equally alarmed.

"Mom. sit down...", Zoe said as she took the empty glass from her hands. To your surprise, mom allowed Zoe to lead her to the family room and seat her on a couch.
You and Zoe sat on either side of her and for a while no one said anything.
