"I'm not doing it! I'd rather take my chances in a lawsuit than to take this payoff", mom said resolutely. "Zoe, hand me the phone."

Zoe reached for the cordless phone lying on the coffee table and handed it to mom.

Mom dialed and after a few rings it was answered on the other end.

"Hello, Jerry, This is Rebecca..."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Mom rejects the payment

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Jerry is your family's lawyer, though you knew mom hadn't needed to call him for some years. The last time she had was when some drunk had decided to remodel mom's car a couple of years ago. She came out of it perfectly fine, but the car was a total write off. "Yes, I know its been a long time. I've got real strange case for you. When I tell you, don't think I'm crazy, I've got all the supporting documentation, including a letter from today indicating a two million dollar attempt to silence me..." mom started explaining before she took herself upstairs. You wanted to follow her, since its really your life mom's discussing, but a glance from Zoe told you to stay downstairs.

"Zoe, I wanna know" you whined.

"I know you do, but... do you want to be that stereotypical little girl that eavesdrops on everything?' Zoe said.

"No" you said, almost in a poutingly way. "What do you think of this?"

"I'm not quite sure if mom is right in rejecting the payout" Zoe said guardedly. "But I am concerned about her. She's drinking more."

You nodded. "I know. Yes, I want them to pay, but I don't want mommy ruining herself in the pursuit of revenge."

Zoe remained silent for a couple minutes. "Jazz, I had Nathan come up to me today" Zoe said, changing the subject. "He told me that he talked to you and that will be coming over to cheer you up."

A surge of terror flowed through your body. Nathan thought the serum just regressed you, and there was no way you wanted him to know it flipped your gender too. Quick, help me" you urged your tomboy sister. You looked around and leaped up, somehow dislodging the cap Zoe wore. She watched you as you grabbed your hair and stuffed it under the hat. "Don't you have anything I can put on?" you asked, wanting to get out of the dress.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Jerry is the family lawyer

choices: A meeting with the lab representatives to settle out of court
Accepting the lab's initial payoff offer
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"I have just the thing for you Jazz. Come with me.", Zoe said as she headed upstairs.

You both went upstairs where Zoe grabbed a pair of male shorts and a blue T-shirt for you to put on. You were surprised to realize that these clothes were new and not any of your old clothes or belonging to James. Zoe saw your expression and chuckled, "Remember when we went to the mall to shop for clothes for you? I just had to grab these although Ella had gotten you all those feminine clothes. Now these have come in handy. Quick, put them on before Nathan gets here."

You gratefully put the boyish clothes on and was quite pleased with the effect. As you looked at yourself in the mirror, you realized that it was not so hard to look like a boy again, with the help of a hat or other headgear.

"Damn, If only I had known, I would have done this long ago", you said.

Zoe laughed, "well, butt head, all you had to do was to ask me, I would have fixed you up."

"Yeah, yeah.... better late than never. ....All you have to do when Nathan gets here is not to breathe a word that I am a girl", you said, a little more seriously.

You both headed back downstairs, just as Ella entered the family room followed by James. They had been over next door.

"Hey, what happened to you??", Ella blurted. James looked at you, noticing the change for the first time.

"Good news, I'm a boy again!", you joked.

"H-h-how did that happen?", sputtered Ella, "Zoe, when did this happen"

"Jazz's just pulling your legs guys. Nathan is coming over and we don't want him to be bugged out by seeing Jazz as a girl just yet, so I gave him the clothes he's wearing", Zoe smiled.

"Well, I don't like it!", Ella pouted.

"Tough bananas Ella.", Zoe retorted.

Before Ella could reply, the door bell rang.

"That's Nathan, guys remember what I said, not a word...", you warned.

Zoe went to answer the door while you settled in one of the couches. Ella and James left the room, Ella muttering something about having other things to do. James headed toward the kitchen, to raid the fridge, you thought.

Zoe returned with Nathan who stopped and stared at you the moment he entered the family room area.

"Dude....wow....this is mad, ....crazy...", was all he could manage.

"Yeah, it's me, just a little smaller.", you said, trying to make light of the situation and alleviate his obvious discomfort at seeing you like this.

"Man, this is weird. ...How does it feel to be a small boy again Jazz?", he asked with awe. You took mental note that your best friend had not done the usual back slapping, buddy handshake routine with you. How could he, with someone who has become a total stranger, practically overnight?, you thought ruefully.

"It takes a little getting used to, but I'm getting the hang of it", you replied.

"Hey, what's with the cap?", Nathan asked, and before you could stop him, he knocked the cap from your head.

You watched as Nathan's expression changed to shock, as your long flowing hair fell to your shoulders. Zoe stifled her shocked outburst, making only a muffled cry.

"Whooaa, ....Jazz...your hair has grown! Is that because of the serum?", Nathan finally sputtered.

"Yeah..", you sighed. You did not offer any further explanation, leaving Nathan to draw his own conclusion.

"OK, then. We'll just have to get used to your new look then", he said.

You were about to invite Nathan to your room for a video game but remembered that it had undergone a pink makeover thanks to your siblings.

"Hi Nathan", mom said as she entered the family room from upstairs. "Jazz, may I see you in the kitchen?"

"OK Mom.", you said as you followed her to the kitchen. James was finishing a sandwich, and as you entered, he took the last bites and left for his room.

Mom went to the sink and after a few minutes, turned to you and said, "Jerry agrees that we have a case against the lab but he's asking me if I am sure I wanted to go ahead with this."

"Why would he say that mom?", you asked.

"Jerry thinks that this case is a sensational one already and will attract some unwanted media attention. I actually forgot about that...", mom sighed.

"What did he recommend then mom?", you asked, your voice betraying your increasing concern.

"He recommended..."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Zoe goes upstairs

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"...that I take their payment offer" mom said, her face red with annoyance.

You looked at her concerned, wondering what she was going to do. "Two million..." you started to say, but mom cut you off.

"Damn it Jasmine. Its not about money. Its about justice" mom said. you winced at her using 'Jasmine' and you spun around, fearing that Nathan was going to be standing there, mouth open with shock. but after about thirty seconds, he didn't appear, nor did you hear any sound.

"Mom. the only justice I'll get is if they acknowledge their actions and I'm not paraded like a freak show exhibit" you said as you spun around. While you're concerned about mom, you're more concerned about anyone hearing mom's outburst. You walked into the family room area, and saw that Nathan was still sitting in a couch, talking to Zoe.

"Hi Jazz" Nathan said, in a way showing he wasn't any more freaked out than he was. You breathed a slight of relief; he didn't hear mom's comments. "I was just going to ask you before your mom called you in, why the cap?"

"You saw my hair. I have to wear it so" you groaned slightly.

"Yes, but why don't you cut it off?" Nathan suggested. Zoe gave you a look, confirming your thoughts. If you cut your hair and styled it boyishly, Ella would have a major freak-out, and you doubt mom would be too happy about it either. If you refused to cut it, Nathan would know something's up, and probably guess the truth. Better think fast, you thought to yourself.

"The serum." you said, shaking your head. "Those 'scientists' said its going to continue to make things like my hair grow really fast. And since I don't want daily haircuts, its best to keep it at this length."

"Daily haircuts?" Nathan said, shaking his head, though you could see he brought it. You felt pleased with yourself too, since that explanation covers your nails, which were starting to get worryingly long, though Nathan didn't appear to see or care about them.

"Nathan, what am I going to do about Chelsea? I know she's going to dump me..." you asked.

"I'll think of something for you, Jazz. Better get going. I guess your mom is planning something" Nathan said, getting up. "Tell me when you can play some video games or something."

"Sure" you replied, as you watched him leave. Once he was gone, you headed for your room, but you got a shock. Ella's something to do apparently meant waiting in your room. You stared at your girly sister. "out!"

"Real nice going, Jasmine. You lied to your closest friend" Ella said in a displeased tone.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Accepting the lab's initial payoff offer

choices: Next day, a curious call from your old school
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Yeah, I lied but for good reason", you said as you flopped down on the bed. "I really am not in the mood to argue with you on this so just drop it.", you continued.

"But Jazz, how long can you keep up the lies? sooner or later you will have to come to grips with the fact that you are a girl and all your friends would have to know...", Ella said.

"I really don't want to talk about this now Ella.", you snapped.

"You will have to face reality whether you like it or not.", Ella replied.

"OK. I'll leave you with your conscience then.", Ella said as she got up to leave the room. You just sighed and buried your head in the pillow.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: continue

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Damn it" you said softly, almost inaudibly, to yourself as you waited for kindergarten to finish. The day had been one big nightmare since you woke up....

"What's that smell?" you asked yourself as you opened your eyes that morning. A strong, aromatic smell was in your room, almost like... fearfully, you looked at your hands, and as you feared, your nails were candy pink. "Ella!"

--------------------

"But mom!" you whined.

"I'm sorry Jazz, but there is no polish remover in the house" mom said.

"But..."

"Trust me, Ella and I will have a talk about this, but there is nothing I can do until this evening." You looked at mom despairingly, fuming at Ella's prank. "Great, now I can't wear my new clothes..."

"About that Jazz" mom said, apparently hearing you. "I don't care what you wear inside, but I insist you don't wear those clothes outside."

"But mom" you whined even louder.

"Tomboy clothes are okay, young lady, but I can't having you dressed like a boy" mom said.... You groaned loudly, just wondering what the difference was between you dressing tomboyishly and being dressed like a boy.

---------------------------

"Nice dress" Jonathon mocked as you sat down for another mind-numbing kindergarten class. He smiled meanly at you. "So I guess you're going to be playing with that cootie-brat Lilith?" You winced, since it was obvious even to this oaf that you was caught between a tug of war between Connie and Lily. You sighed.

--------

"But Jasmine" Lily whined.

"Sorry, Lily, but Connie asked me to play first. I'll play later..." you said, probably being the highlight of your day, since you could act tomboyish.

------------------------

"Mom better have the remover" you muttered as class finished. You looked out and your heart sank as you saw...
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Next day, a new situation

choices: "Want to go out somewhere? Do something fun? Just us."
"Alright, let's take you home. Maybe we can play some videogames."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You pushed past the crowds of children. You were ready to just get home. The day had been tiring and upsetting. You were really looking forward to a nap and some videogames. You wanted out of the dress and to remove that nail polish. You stood by the gates that would eventually release all of the kids. You stood impatiently, waiting for your mother. You fidgeted with the dress. A familiar car slowly rolled up to the curb. Before he was out of the car, you knew it was Nathan.

Nathan looked around, clearly searching for you. Well, he was searching for the boy version of you. Nathan began calling for you, "Jazz? Buddy, where are you?" Nathan opened the gate and walked in. He walked around calmly, searching for you.

You didn't want him to see you in a dress but you couldn't leave him walking around searching for you either. You waved at him, "Over here."

Nathan walks closer, "Excuse me, have you seen my friend, Jazz?"

You look down, embarrassed, "Nathan, it's me."

Nathan stared at you, "How do you know my name?"

"How else, moron. It's Jasper." you whisper, trying not to cause a commotion.

"Did Ella put you in a dress? Is it punishment for something you did? What did you do?" Nathan asked quickly.

"Look, I'll explain it in the car," you say nervously, "but not in public." You look around at the few kids who were still here.

Nathan nodded and you were about to follow him to the car when suddenly Lily tapped your shoulder. You turned around. Lily looked at you, "Jasmine, can we play today?"

"Ummm not today. Maybe tomorrow." you say.

Lily pouted slightly, "Okay. Promise?"

"Promise," you state as she skips away, satisfied.

You look up at Nathan who used to be slightly shorter than you, "Ready?"

Nathan smirks, "Ready, Jasmine." He put emphasis on Jasmine and you frown but follow him to his car. He opens the back door and to your surprise, buckles you into a booster seat.

"Where did you get this?" you inquire, squirming in your new seat.

"I have to obey the law so I borrowed it from my neighbor." Nathan says starting the car and driving out of the parking lot.

"So why are you picking me up?"

"Your Mom was busy. Now tell me what's really going on, Jazz."

You sighed reluctantly, "I'm a girl."

Nathan whipped his head around, "WHAT?!"

"Look where you are driving, dude!" you shout. Nathan turned his focus to the road again and you continued, "The serum has changed my gender to a girl, it has on every experiment they've performed at the lab."

"Well what about the guy who had it spill on him and nothing happened?"

"That was a cover up. The man became a teenage girl named Lisa."

"Whoa! Didn't see that coming."

"Neither did we," you say reminiscing on meeting Lisa.

You begin to explain how the serum could have possibly changed your mentality to that of a girl but you took another serum that should buy you more time. You explain that you are hoping to receive the antidote soon because you hate being a small girl. You skip over the incident with Lilith in which you became a complete 5 year old girl. After explaining everything with the doctors, lawyers and investigator, you stare at Nathan waiting for a response. Nathan had kept quiet through your explanation, except for a few nods here and there.

Nathan looked back at you, "I'm still stunned. I mean, only a week ago I was hanging with my best bro and now I'm driving a 5 year old girl around in my car, who is the same person. It's weird. I miss you. The old you."

You look down, letting a few tears roll down your cheek, "Me too, man. Me too."

You look up at Nathan who sees your crying. Nathan gazes at you with sympathy in his eyes,
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Nathan

choices: Time to reach out to your old friends, but how?
Back to the lab for answers
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Hey, tell you what Jazz, let's just go somewhere and hang out for a while and do something fun, just like old times", Nathan suddenly said.

You were a little surprised that Nathan would still want to hang out with you considering that he just found out the truth about your change, which you had lied about in the first place. You suddenly realized what a good friend he really was to want to spend time with you although now you were a mere child.

"Yeah, we could do that, ...but what about mom?", you asked, concerned that she might be mad if you did not return home on time.

"We won't take long and I could always drop you home before curfew.", Nathan said, with a little chuckle.

Nathan adjusted the car's radio until he settled on a pop station. You were silent for a few minutes then asked, "Hey where will we be going?"

"Aww..., well, we could check out the Mall for starters...", Nathan replied. You looked out the window and saw that you were passing the City Park which was a few minutes from the Mall.

"OK, that would be cool.", you said.

_______________________

No sooner had Nathan pulled up at the Mall and parked than a group of five guys, who were actually part of your old school's basketball team, came up to Nathan, "Hey dude, whats up?", the biggest one grinned, "Taking your baby sister out, eh?", he ribbed. The other boys laughed, "Yeah, baby sitter, whats up?", one of them hooted, to more laughter.

You felt terrible and wished you had not agreed to go with Nathan after all. Nathan, however, calmly replied, "Yeah Josh, I'm out with my baby sis today, what are you up to?"

"You know me, just hanging with the guys as usual. Just kickin' it.", Josh replied. "By the way, have you seen Jazz lately?", he asked.

Oh damn! Hope Nathan keeps his mouth shut and not give me up now, you winced as that thought crossed your mind.

"I haven't seen him lately", Nathan replied.

"Really, but you are his best bud, how come you haven't seen him?", Josh asked. Before Nathan could reply, he continued, "When you see him, let him know that he has missed a couple of practices and coach is gettin' really mad..."

You gulped, and was a little relieved that none of the guys picked up on it. You knew you were in deep trouble as since school resumed, you were in Kindergarten and had missed quite a few practice games and a big basketball tournament was just a few weeks away. No wonder coach was mad, since you were the team captain. You wondered whether mom had gotten a call from your coach. You made a mental note to ask her about this when you get home.

"Yeah, Josh, I'll let him know", Nathan replied.

"Remember to tell him now,...", Josh said as he and the others walked off.

"That's a close one", you breathed with relief, but you saw in Nathan's expression that he was angry.

"Hey, what's with the dark clouds Nathan?", you asked.

"You don't get it, do you?", Nathan said suddenly.

You were startled and did not know what to say. Where is this coming from?, you thought.

"While you are missing in action, life goes on Jazz. Everyone at school is asking for you and guess what, many of them are coming to me!", Nathan almost shouted.

You were stunned.

"Before yesterday when I finally found out what happened to you, it was easy for me to just say "I don't know", but now, how am I going to face every body, knowing what I know now?". Nathan looked at you, a mixture of frustration and exasperation on his face.

You were now beginning to realize how hard it must have been for Nathan after the field trip to account for you and it dawned on you that in all this, you had not really made any effort to deal with the effects this change was having on your friends and other relationships at your old school.

"This sucks...", you said.

"Damn right it sucks!", Nathan exclaimed, "Ever since that field trip, everything is one big mess and you are not the only one affected. The other day your girlfriend, Chelsea, came crying to me, begging me to talk to you for her because she couldn't reach you..."

"Oh man...", was all you could say. This is indeed a real messy situation and here you were playing kindergarten with a bunch of kids, you thought ruefully.

"Well you better make up your mind Jasper Storms. Continue to play kindergarten with those babies, or do something to get your old life back! It's your choice. There must be something you can do to reverse this,.... this, curse!", Nathan raged.

You felt really awful and suddenly wanted to go home. "You're right Nathan, there is something I can do. Let's go home.", you finally said.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: "Want to go out somewhere? Do something fun...

choices: Zoe and Nathan take you inside
Zoe and Nathan get cold feet
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Shortly after Nathan took you back home, you headed for your room, to sit and brood. Nathan was wrong; you hadn't sat down and done nothing, since you still had your computer, and it still had the records of all your web searches, including those on the lab. Nathan had intended to just drop you off and head home, but he ran into Zoe. Zoe was the only one home, and she looked shocked to see Nathan walk you in, and from the response he gave her, you wasn't the only one that he wanted to rant against. It wasn't too smart, since she had years of practice arguing against Ella.

"I haven't done nothing" you said to yourself as you stared at your room, but as you stared at the pink walls, you realized you argued furiously, but accepted things far too readily. And even thought your ability to act had been seriously curtailed, you accepted there is nothing that could be done too easily. So had mom, in a way. She was too focused on vengeance, and not enough on cures. Unless she saw there is none... Ella tried something, but returned pale, like if she was trapped watching Zoe's horror movies all night... Why wouldn't they tell you? Its your life that has been ruined. Quickly, you jumped off of bed, and headed downstairs, where Zoe and Nathan were still argueing.

"I can't believed you allowed that" Nathan yelled.

"You know my sister" Zoe fired right back. She must had heard your approach, since she turned and faced you.

"I need a ride. I'm going back to that lab" you said.

Zoe looked at you surprised. "Mom won't be too happy..." she started, but Nathan glared at her, like if he was saying, 'so I'm right?' "Fine, but he's coming too" she said.

--------

An hour later, you, Zoe and Nathan were standing in front of the labs entrance, and you could see Zoe was getting cold feet, since she kept muttering something about experimentation. Even Nathan, despite his previous bluster looked uneasy. After all, you surmised that this was the place that reduced you down into a little girl, and he must had been worried that they could do it to him
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Back to the lab for answers

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Jazz... are you sure about this?" Zoe asks. "Mom's gonna kill us..."

Staring down the laboratory building's front door as if it were your mortal enemy, you harden your resolve. "I don't care. I'm tired of being told what's good for me. It's time I made my own decisions, and I'm deciding to go in there and give them a piece of my mind."

With that you march into the building, Nathan and Zoe reluctantly following you. You pace around the foyer for a bit, the receptionist looking at you quizzically as you consider your plan of attack, until you see Dr. Hanson emerge from one of the corridors.

"You!" you shout at the sight of him.

"Oh," he says, "What is it now, Miss... Mister... ugh. What do you want, Storms? ...And where is your mother?"

"I'm sixteen," you assert. "I don't need my mom with me all the time."

"Oh, really?" he sneers. "Think yourself independent, do you? Why the escorts, then?"

You can feel Nathan and Zoe giving you "he's got you there" looks, but you don't think so. "Because this place isn't safe no matter how old you are," you say. "That's what started all this in the first place."

Now Dr. Hanson starts to look angry. "I'll have you know we take safety regulations seriously during our research."

"Yeah, right," you retort. "Is that why you had your experimental goop just sitting there waiting to spill on someone?"

"Hmph. So mistakes were made," Dr. Hanson states coldly. "Never mind that. What's done is done. Now why are you here?"

"I'm here because I want my life back!" you shout. "I'm stuck getting sent to kindergarten and socialising with five-year-olds, and you're gonna do something about it!"

Dr. Hanson is unmoved. "Bah. Feeling emotional today, are we? Calm yourself down and think for a moment. What would you have us do? I understand none of us want this situation to become public knowledge, so how are we meant to justify sending a five-year-old to high school?"

Not having any particular answer to that, you just stand there fuming until Zoe hesitantly speaks up. "There must be something you can do..."

"There isn't," Dr. Hanson flippantly replies. "Certainly not now, and not without creating more problems."

You grunt in frustration at the qualifiers. He clearly hasn't been trying that hard to help you. But first you try for the solution you'd prefer. "Get me an antidote then! I know you can make one if you try!"

"That would be difficult," Dr. Hanson says, "And more to the point, not worthwhile."

"What?!" you growl.

"Are you really so self-absorbed you haven't thought at all about what you're a part of?" Dr. Hanson asks, suddenly raising his voice enough to make you flinch. "Our research is going to change the world, and the sooner it's complete the more lives will be saved. We are not going to waste our time to satisfy one little brat!"

Taken aback, you stand there listening to Dr. Hanson breathe heavily until you see Dr. Blake walk up behind him.

"Ah... Dr. Hanson," he says, "Perhaps I could deal with this interruption?"

"I should think it's already dealt with," Dr. Hanson grumbles. You exchange glares with him as he turns away and stomps off, heading through a door and slamming it behind him.

"I apologise for Dr. Hanson's temper," Dr. Blake says, "But... perhaps you understand him better now? He may not be what you'd call a nice man, but he has good intentions at heart."

"Bullshit," Nathan suddenly spits. Apparently this doctor isn't too scary for him to confront. "The serum obviously works already. You could be using it to help people right now, but you're still keeping it under wraps. I bet that guy just wants it for his own selfish uses."

"That's... not the case," Dr. Blake says. "Just because the serum functions doesn't mean it's safe to use. We barely averted a significant psychological breakdown in this case, and in the long term we don't..." He trails off seeing the concern on your face. "Ahem. Besides, we're only producing the serum in very limited amounts at this point. It's very valuable, and if everyone knew of its effects on humans... well, we could become a target for all sorts of unsavoury types."

"So... what about an antidote?" you ask weakly, trying to get the conversation back on track.

"We've already done more work on that than Dr. Hanson would like," Dr. Blake sighs, "But we haven't accomplished much of anything. Our first test batch was, well... destructive."

"Well... can't you at least get Jazz off school?" Zoe asks.

"We have made contact with the government," Dr. Blake says, "But... I don't know. It would arouse suspicion. I'm sorry, but you must realise you aren't going to achieve anything by being here today. This is a serious matter and it needs to settled formally."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Zoe and Nathan take you inside

choices: Your mother consents, the tests begin.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You did not know what to say to that last statement from Dr. Blake. It appeared that you had encountered another dead end, just like the one with that detective, Harry. What do you do now? you thought. The silence that followed was getting awkward until Zoe cleared her throat and spoke up, "Dr. Blake, please there must be something you could do, for us. Ever since that field trip accident, things have become very hard and confusing. I really wished I had my big brother back...". To your utter surprise, Zoe started to cry.

This was the first time in a very long time you have seen your tomboy sister cry. The thought that she was crying on account of you touched you and you realized that for Zoe, more than Ella, your transformation into this little girl may have been more traumatic than she was letting on. You reached out and touched her sobbing shoulders while Nathan stood by uncomfortably. Dr. Blake adjusted his tie nervously.

Zoe sniffed and wiped away tears, her cheeks red with embarrassment for having broken down in front of Nathan and Dr. Blake. "Sorry about that Dr...but you really don't know what it's like to lose a brother this way. We can't play basketball anymore..."

Dr. Blake replied reassuringly, "I understand and I wish we had the antidote right away to apply. The simple truth is that we are trying but without much success. Something always goes wrong and I'm afraid we'll need much more time to work on it."

"We don't have much time!", you interjected. "Every day that passes, I'm afraid that I will lose myself and be this little girl forever!"

Dr. Blake thought for a moment and then excused himself to retrieve his notes. While he was out of the room, you turned to Nathan and Zoe, "What do you think guys?", you asked hopefully.

"Man, I really hope that this Dr. Blake will find a way to help us", Nathan replied.

Moments later, Dr. Blake returned with a file folder in which you presumed were his notes on your case. He perused the file and after a few minutes said, "There might just be something we could try...".

"What? What?", you asked excitedly.

"It will however require your mother's consent", he murmured.

"OK, we'll get it. Just tell us what it is", Zoe said, a little impatiently.

"We will need to draw some blood from your sister...er brother here and check to see how advanced the youth serum really is and whether there is likely to be any further action by the serum. We would also need to test whether we could apply a new growth inducing drug we are testing to see the results. Granted this may not have the same effect as an age serum but it might buy us some time until one is developed. There might not be anything we can do right now about the gender though."

You listened carefully to what Dr. Blake had to say and you thought you understood what this meant. Zoe and Nathan were also attentive. You got the feeling though that Nathan was not fully comfortable with what he was hearing.

"You mean that Jazz will still be a girl even if she grew?", he asked.

"We will have to test and see", Dr. Blake replied.

"But we have a big basketball game coming up!", Nathan cried.

"Let's put it this way, the quicker Mrs. Storms agrees to have us proceed, the faster we can bring your friend as close to normal as possible."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Keep talking to Dr. Blake.

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"How do you think we should ask mom? She won't be pleased we came here" you asked Zoe as Nathan drove you home.

"I don't know, but she will be glad that both Nathan and I was with you" Zoe replied. You both remained silent for the rest of the journey, thinking of how to tell her. As Nathan pulled up, you saw that James was shooting hoops, almost like he was waiting for you and Zoe to come home.

"Hmm, Nathan. Jazz must be out with Zoe. Ella had..." James stammered, obviously trying to cover for you,, but he was stunned to see Nathan help you out of your booster. He gave a slight smile at your brother.

"I know about princess" he said, smirking slightly. Seeing that you hadn't given up, and hearing that you must be closer to normality put him in a much better mood. You ignored him. "Is mom about? We have so good news for once."

"Yes, she just finished giving Ella her punishment" James said. You didn't wait. you ran inside like an excitable little girl. "Mom. We might have a cure for me" you yelled.

"Jazz? How?" mom said, as she looked closely at you. "You went to that genetics lab, didn't you?"

"Zoe and Nathan were with me" you protested.

"You should had know better" mom said in a disappointed voice.

"I'm sixteen years old" you protested. "And they said they can grow me. Mom, I just need your permission, so...."

"Absolutely not" mom said, much to your surprise.

"Why?"

"Let me guess, Dr Blake told you a 'solution' after that Blake creep all but told you to get used to your new life?" mom said, almost sarcastically. "Did he tell you that this growth drug had serious side effects?"

"Side effects?" Nathan asked. "Like Jazz becoming an oversize five year old?" Mom frowned.

"One of them is an increased risk of increased out of control cellular growth. You know what that is?" mom said. "And what about the fact even if we take those risks, I don't like the idea of them having to test you." She paused, as if she was gathering her thoughts. "I'm sorry, Jasmine, but you're going to have to grow up again. I thought you accepted that after the remodelling of..."

"What? It s my life that's over! What about coach? My friends? My girlfriend?" you almost screamed.

"The risks are far to great' mom said mournfully, seeing that both Zoe and Nathan looked agitated.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Your mother refuses, no tests.

choices: Mom begins to contact everyone to explain your absence
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"I might as well be dead...", you mourned. The others looked at you in surprise. Mom tried to reassure you that her decision was the right one and she had your best interest at heart. You, however were not happy and blurted, "so after all this, I am forced to grow up again?? Do you know what this means?"

Mom tried to reassure you, "No matter what happens Jazz, I love you, we all love you..."

You went on, "I'll be forced to live childhood again as a girl and by the time I'm 16 again, you will be close to 50 years old, mom! Ella and Zoe will be 25 year old adults, even my baby brother James will be an adult. I will be the only child left with no one to hang with! How cool is that???"

"Hey, dude, I'll still be your friend", Nathan said.

"Yeah, Nathan but when you go off as a 27 year old adult by the time I hit 16, where will that leave me??", you yelled.

"You all do not understand what this is doing to me. You all will be going on with your lives, I will be stuck as a child. What if I end up a child with an adult mind by the time I hit 12?? Worse, what if I end up with a childlike mind by the time I reach 16 again, when I should have been 27??", you asked, "Huh?, huh?"

No one answered, as each thought about what you have just said and the implications.

Mom finally said, "but I am still concerned about possible side effects of those drugs the lab is developing. Don't you understand, Jazz, what might happen? We have no way of knowing how badly the drugs will affect your growth rate and even your development. I am prepared to accept you as you are, and be with you as you grow up again."

You were still not happy as you felt that there must be something out there that could help you to return to normal. An idea struck you and you gave voice to it,

"What if the serum's effect is just temporary and will wear off after a few weeks, or months? Shouldn't we at least test to confirm whether this is possible? In the meantime, how will you explain my absence?"

Mom thought for a moment, and sighed, "We can write a letter to your school explaining that you have been sent abroad to live and go to school with a distant relative. That means that you all need to keep what you know very confidential, that means you, Nathan."

Nathan nodded. Zoe said, "That means we need to say the same things to everybody we have come into contact these past few days. What do we say to dad?"

Mom snapped, "Leave your father out of this!...I will prepare the letters and make the calls, do you understand?"

Zoe and Nathan replied in the affirmative. You said nothing, as you felt defeated and resigned to your fate.

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Things moved quickly after mom's decision. She already had a copy of all your numbers, and started to make the calls, as well as write the official letters to your school. you couldn't bare to watch or listen, so you fled to your room. Nathan hesitated, but followed you, not that you cared. You felt you life was over, and you didn't care if he saw your pink, girlish room or not.

"Oh man" he breathed as he saw all the pink. He knew why you was so hesitant to bring him to your room, and began to wonder if he was too harsh about you accepting your fate; to him, it was clear you had nothing to do with your room. Silently, he looked and wondered if he could hook up a video game console or something, but he forgot you no longer had a tv in your room.

"Jazz..." he started, but your 'Jasper phone' starting ringing. It was your friends, learning that you was gone expectantly. You stared at the text, as you found message after message. Finally it was Chelsea's turn. As you read, your started sobbing. Even from the words, you sensed she felt betrayed and disappointed.

"What's up?" Nathan asked.

"Chelsea. She broke up with me. She furious that I didn't tell her that I was going away" you sobbed.

"Its not so bad" Nathan said, trying to comfort you. You continued to sob. Eventually, Nathan saw that his attempts at comforting you wasn't working, so he got up' hoping someone else would be more successful. He wouldn't know that you cried yourself to sleep....

A week later...

choices: You fell violently ill at school and must see the Doctor
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You continued to go to kindergarten but you were not enjoying this. Although you played with Lilith and Connie, your heart was not in it. You even sat quietly at your desk and meekly did what you were told. No protests from you and your teacher at one point wanted to find out why you were so morose. She did not persist, content to let you do what you liked except for when you had homework. Then, you would have to participate n class and answer some questions.

The week went by, but for you, everything was one big senseless blur. Ever since the decision your mom took to tell everyone that you were not in the country, you felt betrayed. All your friends were no longer in touch with you, all that is, except for Nathan who still came around. You noticed however that on each visit, you were having real difficulties relating to him. He always wanted you to play video games and would have liked shooting hoops as you used to do but you were not in the mood, and besides you were too small to handle shooting hoops with your friend.

Your routine for the past week was to get dressed for school, be dropped off by your mom, endure another mind numbing boredom while the teacher taught lessons you had learnt what seemed to you now like a lifetime ago. It was during these moments that you desperately wished you were your old self again and you had never gone on that field trip. Sometimes you became angry at yourself for the loss of control and the fact that everything now is being done for you and you do not have much say over anything. You thought of how you had tried to reason with your mother about taking the lab test, and the resistance your mom had given. You felt trapped.

On Friday the school had to call your mom to come get you.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: at school

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
'Thank you for coming, Mrs Storms" miss Summers said, as mom arrived. Both women met as you and your class was out in the playground. Mom frowned, "Call me Rebecca. What happened? Did Jasmine cause any trouble?"

"No. nothing like that. I'm Candice" miss Summers said. "A couple of days ago, I would had thought one of the boys had done something to your daughter... like pull her hair, but she has some friends she has made next to her now. Connie and Lilith..."

"Yes. Jasmine has told me about them. What exactly happened?"

"I was asking the kids what they wanted to be when they've grown up. I had just asked Connie, when Jasmine started bursting into tears, and before I knew it, she ran out of the class. She curled up by that fake wooden log, and hasn't stopped crying. I sent her friends out to find out what had happened, but neither of them has gotten anything from her. Do you have any idea what would cause your daughter to react like this?" Miss Summers wanted to ask more, since to her, your behavior had been weird from the beginning.

"I do" mom said grimly. "Jasmine is currently experiencing extreme trauma. I thought putting her amongst kids her own age would help..... Let me talk to her." Miss Summers nodded, and lead her out to the play area, where you was still curled up, with a very concerned Connie and Lily asking you what was wrong, as well as things like whether you wanted to play. You was unresponsive. lily noticed mom first. "Mrs Storms? What's wrong with Jasmine?"

"Jazz feels sad because she feels like she lost someone very close to her" mom said, as she picked you up. It stopped you crying. "Mo-mommy?"

"Come on, I'd better take you home" mom said.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: You couldn't stop crying

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Let me know how she is doing, please", Miss Summers said to your mom, and you were comforted by your teacher's concern.

"I'll do that.", mom replied. With that she walked out with you in her arms. You were relieved and comforted by your mother's arms as she walked to the car carrying you. You even like the smell of her perfume and for some strange reason, this smell gave you comfort. As you sniffed and sobbed against her neck and shoulders, mom hushed you and rubbed your back. You became a little calmer, as she continued to soothe you.

"Sweetie, tell me. what's wrong", mom asked as she strapped you into the car seat.

You sniffed, but said nothing. In fact, you did not know how to express the mix of feelings that has come over you. Yes, you were unhappy but what exactly was causing this was not immediately clear. Was it because this was your first day at school and your mom was not there? Or was it because you were scared and really wanted to stay home?

Mom got into the car and started the engine, but she did not immediately drive, instead, she sighed, "Jazz, please, don't shut me out now....Tell me what's wrong. What should I do?"

You looked at mom and although she was not looking at you, you sensed that she was herself close to tears. She continued, "Did I do the right thing, Jazz? Not letting your old school know the truth of what had happened to you?"

You thought about what had taken place a week ago and somehow, it seemed like a lifetime ago. Nothing makes sense to you now and you tried hard to remember what had happened before that week, and came up with nothing. It seemed as though you had just woken up from a bad dream which you knew to be a nightmare but for some reason, you could not recall the details of it.

"Mommy....I wanna go home now.", you said, sounding every bit the five year old you are, and nothing of the teen you were.

Your mom was startled, "Jazz?!....Jasper?!....Are you sure you are alright? I could take you to the doctor right now."

"I'm not a boy mommy, .....Why do keep calling me Jazz?", you protested.

"Oh My God! .... Jazz, what did you just say?!", mom asked, turning to you, the engine still idling.

You saw the anguish on your mom's face and wondered why she was so troubled, after all, apart from your crying fit, which you were still not able to properly explain, you did not see what all the fuss was about.

"You keep calling me Jazz...Why would you do that mommy? You know I'm Jasmine.", you said emphatically.

Mom was silent for a few minutes as she was stunned by your statements. It was as though you were never a boy. You were getting agitated, all you wanted to do now was to leave the school and go home.

"Mommy,...I wanna go home!", you demanded, your little fists tightened, "I wanna go home NOW!", you kicked your little feet furiously at the seat in front of you.

Mom said nothing as she pulled out of the school's parking lot and headed...
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: continue

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You calm down as the car begins moving down the road, and sit contentedly while you wait to return to the comfort of your room. But after a while you realise this is taking too long. You peer out the window and aren't sure of where you are.

"Mommy? Where are we going?" you ask, leaning sideways in your seat to look at her. She doesn't reply, but you can see her pained expression in the mirror, which worries you.

Mom soon parks the car and gets out. You recognise the nearby building as the doctor's office. "Why are we at the doctor?" you ask as Mom lifts you out of your seat, hoping she'll answer you this time. She hesitates for a moment before doing so.

"It's... just for a checkup, dear," she says.

There's something weird about that, but you can't put your finger on it. Well, at least you'll to see Doctor Taylor again. She's a nice lady, and you haven't gone to her since you... since when? You can't remember for some reason.

Mom leads you by the hand into the waiting room, and you look over the various people sitting in chairs. Most of them are boring, but a few look sort of familiar to you. You can't remember where you've seen any of them, though, and they're not saying hello or anything.

"I need to see Dr. Taylor right away," Mom tells the receptionist in an urgent manner. Again, something's not right here, but you don't know what. Mom and the receptionist say some more things, but they talk quieter and you can't hear them. You wander over to the little play house in the corner and start arranging the dolls in the order you think they'd like best, but you keep having to glance back at Mom and wonder why she looks so upset.

Before long, Mom walks over to you and takes your hand. "Jasmine, it's time to see the doctor now," she says. You wave goodbye to the dolls as she leads you away.

"Hi, Dr. Taylor!" you say when the doctor turns to see you walking through the door into her office. She looks somehow confused.

"Um, hi," she halfheartedly waves. "Becca, who is...?"

Mom leans in close to the doctor and says something quietly, eliciting a very strange look. then she opens another door. "Jasmine, honey, you wait here, alright?"

You pout, but Dr. Taylor cheers you up by reaching for a lollipop and handing it to you. "Here, you have a lollipop while you wait, okay?"

"Thank you!" you beam, sticking the lollipop in your mouth. Instead of saying "you're welcome," the doctor just stares at you for a moment before following Mom through the door and closing it behind her.

You can just barely hear Mom and Dr. Taylor's voices on the other side of the door. You want to peek out and see what they're saying, but you're a good girl and Mom told you to wait. You pace around sucking on your lollipop until you get bored, then climb up on the doctor's chair and amuse yourself by making it spin. You also try reading the stuff on the computer screen, but there are a lot of really big words that you can't even imagine how to say.

Eventually, Mom and the doctor come back into the room. You grab the table to stop spinning and face them. They gaze down at you without a word until you start to fidget nervously.

"You know," the doctor says softly, "I'd heard they were getting close to this, but I can still scarcely believe..." she trails off seeing Mom's forlorn expression. "Becca..."

Mom covers her face with her palm. "This is my fault," she groans. "I pushed him too far."

"Don't beat yourself up." Dr. Taylor puts a hand on Mom's shoulder. "I know you were only trying to do the right thing."

"So what was the right thing?" Mom sighs.

"I don't know," the doctor says sadly. "But I don't think it's too late to do it."

You're really confused now. You have no idea what the two of them are talking about. They stand in silence for a minute while you sit there awkwardly looking back and forth between them, swinging your legs in the air.

"I'll contact the lab and see if I can learn anything else," Dr. Taylor says, "But from what you've told me, I believe this is mostly psychological. A coping mechanism. I'll get back to you, but in the meantime you should try and find a way to snap him out of it. Something that will remind him of who he is."

Mom just nods and opens the door to leave. "Come on, Jasmine," she says, prompting you to hop off the chair and follow her out. Only when you're nearly out of the building does she add, "I want you to meet someone."
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: To the doctor

choices: mom takes you to Nathan's house
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
"Who mommy?" you asked, curious.

"You'll see, but we have to go home first" mom said. She lead you to the car, and helped you get into your booster seat, though oddly, she didn't get in. Instead she pulled out her phone, and hesitated. Mom knew that Chelsea hadn't been told about what happened to you, and the fact she was left waiting, and thinking that you had just left without even contacting her left her leaving you a tearful and anger-filled message on your phone. That was a mistake, mom thought, knowing that you needed a big jolt to snap you out of your psychologically-induced Jasmine persona. Quickly, she dialled the number.

"Mrs Storms? What? Why are you calling me again? Your jerk of a son...."

'Don't hang up" mom pleaded. "Jazz wanted to call you, but I forbade it."

"You! Why?" your former girlfriend spluttered.

"You know how Jazz went to that genetics lab? There was an accident... and it changed him mom said.

'Whatever" Chelsea said, disbelievingly.

"No, its true. I've got all the evidence at home. however Jazz has gone into shock, and I need your help. Jazz has adopted a coping mechanism..."

"Why are you just saying Jazz? You're being too cautious in talking to me" Chelsea demanded.

Least she is listening, mom thought. She gulped. "The reason why Jazz was forbidden to contact anyone is because the accident turned him into a little girl" mom said. After a few seconds, she asked, "Chelsea?". but she got no response. After a minute, she hung up. After staring at you, she wondered what to do. Most of all, she didn't want to have you doing anything too little girlish, mostly out of fear it would reinforce your coping induced mechanism. Once her Jasmine personality had taken root..., mom thought shaking her head.

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You sat back in your booster seat and stared through the window as mom drove the journey home. Usually on drives home, there would be conversation between you and mom but this time, there was silence. You glanced occasionally at mom and only saw her forlorn expression, which you concluded could be the result of what Dr. Taylor had told her. Of course, you did not know what it was since you were not in the room the whole time.

You continued looking out the window but you were not really connecting with anything you saw outside. You were only thinking of going home as you were very tired and really wanted to take your nap. You looked at mom again and saw from the rear view mirror the tears streaming down her cheeks.

"Mommy, why are you crying?", you asked.

Mom sniffed then groaned, "I should have known better....I shouldn't have pushed you so hard."

You did not know what she meant but you did not ask for an explanation either as your attention was diverted by a man walking a dog by the side of the road. You giggled as the big dog dragged the man who was desperately trying to keep up. You tried to keep your eyes on that scene but as the car turned a corner, you lost sight of it. You sank back into your seat and with nothing else to do, plopped your thumb into your mouth. You took comfort in this action and soon you were contented.

Moments later, you felt the car stop and you opened your eyes to find that you had dozed off and now you were finally home. Mom switched the car off and got out.
She opened your door and was about to unbuckle you from the child seat when she signed, "Ohh Jazz...", in an "Oh no not this", tone of voice as she gently pulled your thumb from your mouth.

You said nothing as she lifted you from the seat, but you promptly put your thumb back into your mouth.

"Lets get inside Jasmine", mom said as she collected your bag from the seat beside you.

_____________________________________________________

You were not sure for how long you had been asleep when mom put you to bed for your afternoon nap, but when you woke up you heard voices downstairs. You crept down and found that mom was talking to Dr. Taylor and a stranger you vaguely recalled but was not sure who he was. You also saw another stranger that was also vaguely familiar sitting beside the first stranger on the same couch. You could tell that the conversation was intense and it was a few minutes before you realized that the conversation was about you.

"I know that this is hard for you Mrs. Storms but by what you described, I can most certainly say that he has regressed further..." the first stranger, a white haired man, said.

"I refuse to believe that Dr. Hanson", mom said, "I really agree with Dr. Taylor that this is purely psychological and he would soon snap out of it."

"Umm,... Rebecca, I'm not so sure now...", Dr. Taylor interjected, sheepishly.

"You see, the youth serum must have been activated again by something that could have triggered him", the other stranger, a balding man, said.

"But what could that be Dr. Blake?", mom asked plaintively.

"When the kids visited the lab on their own the other day, they were desperate for me to tell them of a cure for his condition. I did not have anything to offer at first but then I remembered another drug we are currently working on that could offer some hope...", Dr. Blake continued.

"So you were the one who told my kids about that....that growth drug?!", mom blurted.

"Yes, I did.", Dr. Blake admitted.

"Why would you do that Vernon?", Dr. Hanson interjected, " you know that it is still experimental and hardly ready for full application yet.."

"I know,... but as you can see from what Mrs. Storms just said, we were working against time here. I really wanted her permission to do a blood test to see how far the serum had gone then we could do something about the child's condition.", Dr. Blake went on.

Dr. Hanson nodded, and said nothing more.

"I must ask, did anything happen that could have triggered this drastic change in your son, Mrs. Storms?", Dr. Blake asked.

Mom thought for a moment before answering, "Y-yes, I think it all started when I refused to allow that blood test. At the time I was concerned about the possible side effects of the drug Jazz said you were proposing and I was afraid to risk that on him. How was I to know he would have taken it so hard? The last week was traumatic as I had to tell all his friends and associates that...Oh God, What have I done??...", mom wailed.

"I was amazed at what I saw today doctors, and if Rebecca here had not told me who it was, I would have sworn that she had gone out and had another kid I did not know about.", Dr. Taylor interjected.

You remain hidden by the stairwell, growing increasingly fearful about what is being said about you. Admittedly, you had no idea what most of this meant, but words like "experimental" and "serum" sounded strangely frightening to you.

"It might be too late now to do a blood test just for exploration.", Dr. Blake signed. "Now we must urgently find a way to stop this serum."

"Wh-what do you mean Doctor.?", mom asked, panicked.

"It means that we must ensure that the serum does not go any further to affect you son's brain beyond repair.", Dr. Hanson said dryly.

"How do you propose to do that Doctor?", Dr. Taylor asked. "It seems to me that if this is not psychological but physical, as you are suggesting, then normal psycho-therapy is out of the picture."

Mom looked first at one doctor then the other, "Do you mean that if we do not do anything about the serum, things will only get worse?", she asked.

No one answered immediately and there was an awkward silence in the room.

You suddenly felt fearful and desperately needed your mommy. You ran into the room straight to mom and snuggled beside her. She absently stroked your hair as you curled up beside her.

The two doctors from the Genetics Facility exchanged glances, their faces pale.

"I think we better start that Youth Serum Reversal Protocol right away.", Dr. Hanson said in an awed whisper.

"Jazz, don't you remember what you used to say when the girls argue?", James finally asked.

"Yeah Jazz, you used to say...", Zoe began but mom shushed her, and looked to you to hear what you would reply.

You looked blankly at everyone in the room before replying, "No. But I don't like it when you fight."

Mom left the living room and your sisters returned to bickering at each other. A few minutes later she returned with three photo albums and excitedly placed them on the couch and opened one.

"look at this picture of you when you are around five Jazz", she said as she showed you a picture of a boy on his tricycle with a big grin on his face. You looked at the picture but did not recognize it, although you had in fact seen it many times before. You had even commented on one occasion how silly you looked in that Sesame Street Tee-shirt and blue shorts you were wearing. Now you stared at it with no idea why mom was showing you this photo of a five year old that was obviously not taken recently.

"I dunno who this is mommy. Was this James?", you asked.

Mom was disappointed that you had not recognized yourself but she tried not to betray it. Instead she turned to another picture of you, at around ten years old. "How about this one Jazz? You know who this is?"

You barely glanced at the tall ten year old standing beside his eight year old twins Zoe and Ella. You giggled at the sight of the twins, "Ohh look at Ella and Zoe. So silly in matching outfits. But this can't be James, is it?", you remarked.

"Mom, this is not working!", Zoe protested as you flipped other pages and did not recognize yourself in any of them.

Mom sighed, "You're right. We got to get to the lab after all and do what they had recommended."

She took the photo albums back to where they were kept while your siblings tried to jog your memory in other ways.

"Jazz, remember when we played basket ball together how you usually ran rings around us..."

"No, remember how protective you were of us? You wouldn't allow anyone to tease us at the playground...Remember?"

"What about that time in the Mall, when..."

"OK. That's enough. Jazz, lets get you dressed for the Lab. We will leave in a few minutes", mom said as she entered the room.

_________________________________________________________

"I'm glad you decided to try this procedure out", Doctor Hanson said as he finished his examination of you. You mom simply replied, "Yes. I guess it has to be done."

"What we will be doing is to administer a serum inhibitor which will stop the effect of the serum and begin to reverse what has been happening to your son.", Doctor Hanson continued. Mom nodded.

"Once we start this treatment, we will have to monitor how it is doing so you will need to bring him back for follow-up assessments.", Doctor Hanson said as he put his notes on his desk.

"How many treatments will this take, Doctor?", mom asked.

"Well, Mrs. Storms, from our examination just now, we think the serum has done some damage to your son's brain, that is the portions that control emotion and memory.", the Senior Geneticist replied. "It will take about five treatments to get him back to normal. The first few hours are however crucial. During this time we will know whether the Inhibitor will work".

"OK", your mom replied, "Let's get started then."

Doctor Blake entered the room with some documents.

"Mrs. Storms, Normally we would have asked you to go to our Administrative Section to sign some paperwork as soon as the procedure is explained. You, know, "Informed Consent". We have however taken the liberty of bringing the paperwork to you, given the urgency of what we need to do." Doctor Hanson said as Doctor Blake handed him the documents.

Mom took the documents.

"Please take a look at this as well as this section that explain our legal obligations, and the indemnities.", Doctor Blake instructed as he pointed to sections on the documents your mom was about to sign.

________________________________________

The procedure for you was surprisingly simple, just an injection followed by ingesting of a sweet tasting medicine. You expected that you would be heading home right after, but you were actually placed in a room with a hospital bed and other apparatus. A soon as you were put to bed, you fell asleep.

You did not know how long you were out for, but when you woke up it was night, at least you thought so by the number of lights that were on in the building. Your eyes took a while to focus until you saw mom, and your brother and sisters looking anxiously at you. No one else was in the room.

At first, you did not know why you were in this strange room, until you remembered that you and your mom had come to the lab earlier. You could still feel the spot where you were injected, although the sensation was a little duller now than before.

Just then, the two doctors that you had seen earlier, Doctors Hanson and Blake entered the room with a nurse you had not seen before. Doctor Hanson smiled at you and said, "How's the little fellow now? Mind if I check your chest and arm?", he asked. You shook your head and looked at your mom for confirmation. She smiled reassuringly at you.

After the Doctor was through with your examination, he frowned and beckoned his colleague for a quick consultation. You did not really pay attention to what they were doing but you saw that your mom was becoming concerned. "What's the matter?", she asked but the doctors were still whispering urgently with each other while the nurse was trying to make you comfortable by adjusting the bed.

"Doctors! What's the matter with my son?", mom asked again.

Doctor Hanson cleared his throat while Doctor Blake adjusted his tie nervously. The nurse left the room. Your siblings looked at the doctors eagerly while you were trying to fight the sleep that was coming over you.

Doctor Hanson finally spoke....

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
The weeks that followed were ones of adjustment, for your family that is, as you continued to behave like the five year old you were. No sign of your former self was seen. Even when your siblings tried to stimulate your memories of when you were a male, you just could not relate. They eventually gave up, especially since your mommy took you back to Dr. Taylor who could not find anything physically wrong with you and with the help of a Child Psychologist colleague of hers, tested you and concluded that your behavior and mannerisms were that of a normal five year old girl.

Your days at kindergarten were remarkably fun-filled, as you enjoyed playing and interacting with the other kids your age. Your teacher, Miss Summers, was quite surprised with your change of behavior although she did not know what caused it. It seemed to her that you were a completely different person.

You had no connection with your old school and your former friends. It was as though the old Jazz never existed. How could he?, for as far as you were concerned, he was a figment of somebody's imagination. You still could not explain why you were never in your family photo albums although there were these mysterious photos of a boy you just did not recognize, although your mom and siblings insisted it was you.

The Genetics Lab, that had caused the problem in the first place approached your mommy about a week after your procedure and together with your mommy and her lawyers crafted an agreement which saw the Lab making a generous settlement to finance your care and education until age 21 or after you have finished your education. Part of that fund would be put aside in Trust for you to access when you achieved the age of 18. In exchange, your entire family were never to mention the existence of the Youth Serum. Not that it mattered to you, as you had no recollection of the accident on the Field Trip to the Genetics Facility.

The only former friend you had a new connection with was Nathan, who still came around. The day you returned from the Genetics Lab, Nathan came by but for some strange reason, you did not recognize him, so your mom re-introduced him as a friend of the family. Nathan had to adjust his relationship with you, no longer referring to you by your old nickname, but by your name "Jasmine".

The person who had the hardest time with your transformation was your daddy. Your mommy eventually called him and explained what happened to you. He was upset that he was not told before and he could not accept that he did not have his son anymore. You, of course did not understand the extent of his anger, and you felt rejected by your father, who did not even attempt to speak to you over the phone. His infrequent visits to the family stopped altogether (although he continued to send the child support payments). It took much effort from your mommy to get you not to harbor ill-feelings about your daddy.

__________________________

It was one year since that fateful Field Trip to the Genetics Facility, which of course you had no memory of, and a lot had changed. Your mommy sold her house and closed her business and took the family away to another State. You were enrolled into an Elementary School, while your siblings were enrolled into new high schools. Nathan of course was sad to see you go, but you had exchanged numbers and promised to keep in touch.

On the first day in your new school, you were asked by your new teacher, Mrs. Baker, to introduce yourself to your classmates. You stood up, and with as much confidence as you could muster in your, slightly taller, six-year-old body, announced:

"I am Jasmine Storms, but my friends call me Jazz."

"We'll just have to take our chances on that wouldn't we?", mom said with just a hint of petulance in her tone.

"Let's just say that your son is lucky this time, Mrs. Storms. It could have been much worse.", Doctor Hanson replied. "We can monitor his progress from now on so why not take him back to the lab, say in about two weeks from now to see if his improvement continues?"

"Its already late so you might as well keep him overnight and we leave first thing in the morning. Do you have anywhere here we can stay with him?", mom asked.

"We can arrange to have another bed brought in here for you to keep your son company through the night if you wish. We can also have another room prepared for your kids to sleep.", Doctor Blake volunteered.

"That would be fine", mom replied.

You had not said anything throughout this exchange because you were still not as alert as you were before. As the chemically induced fog cleared your mind became a little sharper. Your next words however startled everyone.

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Mom smiled slightly, since your language was more mature that that you've recently used. "You're back at the genetics lab, Jazz" mom said, but her smile vanished as you said your next words.

"But mom. I'm Jasmine, not 'Jazz'!" you said pouting,

"Jazz?!" mom said, as you placed a hand on your head. "Mommy, I feel so confused..."

"About what, sweetie?" mom said, as her heart sank.

"My memories.... they're so jumbled. And mommy, please don't treat me like Ella. I'm Jazz!"

Mom paled. "Dr. Blake! I need help now" mom screamed, freaked out by your behavior. The doctor came and mom swiftly explained what was happening. You listened, but felt confused by everything. Finally Dr Blake turned to you.

'So Jasmine, how do you feel?" Dr Blake asked.

"My head's sore and I'm scared" you said, cringing slightly at the slight of him.

"Scared about what?"

You was scared of him, but you remained quiet about that. "I feel like I've got two sets of memories. One is that of a big boy, and the other is a little girl, and I don't know which is real, and...' you gulped. Dr Blake looked at you silently as you explained, but gave a small nod as you finished. He noted that your speech had changed mid-sentence.

"So which memory seems to be real?" Dr Blake asked.
1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.title: Jasmine is confused

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
You did not immediately answer the doctor but you were sure you were a little girl and that the other "memories" were more like dreams. Mom looked anxiously at you and your siblings, who had entered the room, were just as anxious to hear what you would say.

"Which memory feels real to you now?", asked the Geneticist again.

You looked apprehensively at the doctor, of whom you were still scared, and whispered "I'm a little girl. I've always been one. ... I want my mommy."

You saw the worried expression on the doctor's face which he quickly replaced with a neutral expression as he turned to your mommy. "Ah....Mrs. Storms?....We need to speak privately."

You watched as both your mommy and the doctor retreated to a corner of the room to talk privately. Moments later your mommy screamed, "No! No! Nooo! Doctor, please,....It can't be!..."

The doctor tried to reassure her but your mommy was still reacting to the words she just heard.

"Doctor, you promised that things would have been OK with the procedure, but now you are telling me...Oh God, what am I to do now?", she wailed.

"Please Mrs storms, don't get ahead of yourself now, we can fix this. It could be that your son is suffering temporary amnesia...", Dr. Blake replied while reaching out to hold her.

You saw your mommy brush the doctor's arm aside and walked over to where you were. "Kids, we are leaving and I'm taking Jazz with me", she said resolutely.

"I'm afraid you can't do that", Dr. Blake interjected as he walked over to you as well. You cringed as you felt somehow threatened by what was unfolding.

"Mommy!..", you whimpered.

"Mommy is here", she said as she scooped you up from the bed. You noticed that your twin sisters were quietly crying in the background while your brother looked forlorn. You did not quite understand why they were like this.

"I must insist the you cannot leave!", Dr. Blake said sternly.

You felt your mommy's body tighten. "Oh yeah Dr. Blake?, Make me!", she hissed.

What happened next felt like a scene from a movie. Dr. Hanson who had been quietly reviewing his notes and your chart and had not said anything, quickly approached your mommy.

"What's this?!", your mommy protested as Dr. Hanson made a grab for you, "Hey! No, get your hands off!....", mommy yelled as your twin sisters burst out crying. "You can't touch him!" she snapped as she held you closer to her body.

"OK, Mrs. Storms, please, calm down. We are reasonable adults here and I do apologize for causing you alarm like this.", the Senior Geneticist said in soothing tones.

"Oh no you don't", mommy replied. "I won't allow you to touch my child again. I should never have agreed to that procedure which your Dr. Blake is now telling me is irreversible!"

"But....but, we can fix this...You won't get your son back, but you could at least have a well adjusted daughter...", Dr. Blake intervened.

"No! You have done enough damage. We're leaving."

With you in her arms, your mommy strode out of the room with her children in tow. The doctors did not attempt to stop her.

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
James realized as soon as he saw them look at each other that your twin sisters wanted to race to your room to immediately start doing girly things with you. He raced to your room ahead of them and surprised you as he burst in.

"Hey Jas', why don't you and I hang out for a bit?", he said locking the door behind him. You were still startled, as you did not expect this enthusiasm from your brother.

"Oh, O.K.", you said, putting the doll you were playing with down.

"Fine, then. What do you want to do with yourself now?", he asked.

"I never thought of that, really. Why the sudden interest?", you asked, a little suspiciously.

"Ah,.. I just thought I'd ask you since, you know...you're a..", James said, hesitantly.

"You mean now that I have nothing to do?", you asked. The past few days were weird to say the least and you still did not get why everybody around you were acting so strangely. You noticed that your mommy appeared at times to be unsure of how to relate to you, and what with the constant insistence before, that you were a different person? For all you knew you have always been a girl and now that you were five years old, what does everyone expect of you?

The banging on your bedroom door interrupted your thoughts. The twins wanted James to let them in but he ignored their pleas.

"Why don't you open the door James?", you asked.

"Oh, let them stay there, I don't want them in here while we talk.", your brother replied.

The banging continued, and your sisters were asking to be let in.

You got up and opened the door despite your brother's protests.

"Thanks Jasmine. James, why didn't you open up?", Ella asked her brother accusingly.

James got up from the bed and went to one of the chairs in your room. "Because I didn't want any of you to be an influence on Jas', I really don't", he sulked.

"We would never do that now, would we?", Ella said sweetly while Zoe murmured her agreement.

"Yeah, we are all sisters here, and you are our big brother", Zoe added.

James smiled despite his misgivings, at Zoe's reference of him as "big brother". "Yeah, that's right I am now the big brother and I think...", he started but Zoe interjected.

"Ah bro, don't let that "big brother" power get to your head, remember we are still older than you, and we know what's best for Jasmine.", she said.

"Oh yeah. Then ask her who she would rather hang out with, me or you?", your brother retorted.

"That's easy, she would rather hang out with us any day, ain't that right, Jasmine?", Ella replied.

You looked at your sisters then at your brother and smiled at the thought that they were fighting over a chance to hang out with you. You found it amusing that they needed to do that since as far as you could remember, you had always enjoyed playing with your twin sisters, while your brother hung out with his friends. You did not want to hurt your brother's feelings though so you responded with what you thought was a good compromise.

"I like hanging out with all of you. James, what game shall we play today?", you smiled.

"Ha, Ha, I win, now you guys scoot out of here so that we can play our game!", James laughed triumphantly.

"O.K. James, you win this time, but we will see Jasmine later anyway, so we better go see what Mom is doing.", Zoe said, taking her twin by the hand and leading her, protesting of course, to the door.

As soon as the girls left, James took out a video game, that you used to love playing and were good at, and set it up. Although you were not familiar with that game, you allowed him to set it up and you both started. While playing, James continued asking about what you wanted to do with yourself. You really did not have much to say about 'dreams' as you had never thought of that, and anyway, you were making wrong moves in the game, as you actually couldn't understand how to play it, and your brother was winning. It was only after winning for the umpteenth time did it dawn on James that you did not know how to play that game.

"Why didn't you tell me?", he finally asked, as he turned off the game.

"Tell you what?", you asked, puzzled.

"Why didn't you tell me that you couldn't play this game at all? That you would rather do girly things with your sisters?", he asked hurt.

"I thought... I don't know...Oh alright, I didn't want to hurt your feelings. As far as I remember, we never hang out together. You were always with your friends.", you blurted.

James was crestfallen. It had not occurred to him that your total transformation meant that everything he knew about you will never be the same. It took him a few moments for it all to sink in. He finally sighed and gave you a hug. "I love you sis.", he said.

1111121121121212222211111122122112211112.content:
Your Mom checked you out of the school and got you in the car. You sat helplessly in your new booster seat. You stared out the window, watching the familiar landmarks of your neighborhood go by. Occasionally, you would catch a glimpse of your reflection in the window which didn't help you feel better. You were extremely confused about your identity. On the inside, you were an average 16 year old boy but on the outside, everyone saw a 6 year old little girl. Even when you looked in reflections, you couldn't identify and trace of who you used to be. You looked like an innocent, young girl. The car stopped in your driveway, you hadn't even noticed you had arrived home. Your Mom helped you out of the booster seat and led you into the house. She was saying something, you figured it was probably some sort of attempt at comforting you. You ignored her and ran to your room. Your Mom called your name but after you didn't respond she left you alone to your thoughts.

You walk into your room and stare blankly at the vibrant pink walls. Your eyes watered at the sight of your room. You thought back to when you had white walls (of course dirtied up a bit here and there). You walk to the closet and look at the racks and shelving, flourishing with girly childish attire. You spot a few boxes in your closet you never noticed, you pull them out with a lot more effort than you would prefer. You pop the cardboard open and dig through what seems to be some of your old things. You smell the fabric of some tee shirts and detect the slight smell of cologne. You smile, it was Chelsea's favorite cologne. You peel back the shirts, revealing some old photos. You freeze, unable to pick up a photo. You know what these photos hold. The memories of your past. The top photo was of you and James posing on a bench by a basketball court. Your brown hair a sloppy and unkept. You feel your eyes watering and you swallow the rising lump in your throat.

You recalled that your best friend Nathan was one of the pals you had invited over. That day, you remembered, was a good day after all.

You remembered that your mom had stayed with you for most of your hospital stay. :I just haven't gotten around to it. Hey, I have an idea, why don't we do this together as a project?", mom suggested. You smiled, "That would be great mom. We can do that", you said eagerly.
